title: Store General Manager - Gun Hill Bronx, NY
description:
Create a healthier, brighter future for pets, pet parents and people!


If you want to make a real difference, create an exciting career path, feel welcome to be your whole self and nurture your wellbeing, Petco is the place for you.


Our core values capture that spirit as we work to improve lives by doing what’s right for pets, people and our planet.


* We love all pets like our own
* We’re the future of the pet industry
* We’re here to improve lives
* We drive outstanding results together
* We’re welcome as we are


Petco is a category-defining health and wellness company focused on improving the lives of pets, pet parents and Petco partners. We are 29,000 strong and operate 1,500+ pet care centers in the U.S., Mexico and Puerto Rico, including 250+ Vetco Total Care hospitals, hundreds of preventive care clinics and eight distribution centers. We’re focused on purpose-driven work, and strongly believe what’s good for pets, people and our planet is good for Petco.

**Position Overview**


The General Manager is responsible for leading through Petco’s vision of “Healthier Pets. Happier People. Better World.” in order to develop a high-performing team that consistently delivers top-line sales growth while maintaining a focus on the welfare, health, and proper care of all animals. The GM leads a team Pet Care Center managers, leaders and partners and is accountable for all aspects of managing a single Pet Care Center. The General Manager drives their business through a focus on people (talent acquisition, training, and development), performance (guest service, sales, and expense control), and process (standard operating procedures and policies), which will result in overall profitability. This position requires a passion for pets, ability to inspire and lead a team, focus on process excellence, a drive for results.

**Position Responsibilities**

The GM regularly exercises discretion and independent judgment as they execute all Pet Care Center activity to create the best possible partner, guest, and pet experience. As a leader of people & pet care, the GM should execute all tasks skillfully and consistently. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.

**People**

* Build a team that embodies the Petco brand by delivering exceptional service and driving guest loyalty.
* Attract, hire, and retain a diverse team of top talent.
* Train, coach, and develop leaders and hourly Pet Care Center partners in all areas and functions required to run the store efficiently and to Petco standards, including the effective rollout selling models.
* Create a professional environment that inspires and encourages the growth and engagement of partners.
* Lead and implement a positive culture of teamwork, inclusion and collaborate by working alongside the team, establishing priorities, and provide clear direction.
* Ensure quick and courteous service to all Petco guests by helping partners determine the guest’s needs and by sharing product knowledge with partners to enable them to suggest the appropriate solutions to meet the customer’s needs.
* Responsible for all partner performance management in the Pet Care Center.
* Demonstrate and support a continuous improvement and growth mindset.

**Performance**

* Meet or exceed goals related to totals Pet Care Center sales, profitability, and operational excellence.
* Schedule and adjust labor hours & payroll to maximize productivity, achieve sales & payroll goals, and complete workload.
* Review and interpret financial and operational reporting regularly, including Pet Care Center visits and audit results.
* Identify underperforming metrics and develop strategies that leverage Petco programs, tools, and resources to improve and grow the business.
* Market the Pet Care Center and its products, oversee planning of on site and community events, such as adoptions, school visits and other local promotions and animal-welfare events.

**Process**

* Ensures the proper health, appearance, welfare, and proper handling of all animals.
* Ensures merchandise is properly priced, displayed and stocked according to inventory levels appropriate for the store; make merchandising decisions with consideration of visual standards, special ad set-up and monthly ad planner guidelines, adjusting these as necessary to best implement in each individual store.
* Completes and submits accounting, inventory management and payroll paperwork in a timely manner; ensures all expenses are maintained within budgeted levels.
* Maintains the Pet Care Center's appearance adheres to Petco operational standards and safety procedures.
* Protect Petco pets & merchandise and minimize loss by ensuring all Pet Care Center standards and operating procedures are met, including workplace safety, inventory control, and loss prevention.
* Ensures Pet Care Center is opened/closed in accordance with policies and procedures, especially those relating to safety and security.
* Responsible to maintain the Pet Care Center’s professional image, appearance, and cleanliness.

**Other Essential Duties**

* **MODEL INSPIRING LEADERSHIP**. Model leadership and selling behaviors to Pet Care Center partners and associates. Provide proactive leadership to maintain a positive business climate that motivates Pet Care Center teams in alignment with our company goals. Serve as an effective advocate for change and growth.

* **PROMOTE SAFETY**. Ensure Petco policies, procedures and safety standards are closely observed and executed, and all new policies and procedures are properly implemented in the Pet Care Center. Bottom line, the safety of partners, guests and pets is our #1 priority.

* **FOSTER A COLLABORATIVE CULTURE**. Establish and promote a culture that encourages partners to seek and formulate ideas and opportunities that increase efficiency and that improve guest engagement, guest satisfaction and company image. Ensure a culture that values and promotes teamwork.

* **PRIORITIZE TALENT DEVELOPMENT**. Ensure a strong talent bench with partners who can successfully execute the company’s plans, meet objectives, and manage an engaged workforce. Ensure continuation of excellence in Petco’s partners through developmental programs and leadership opportunities. Actively pursue the development of bench strength through internal training and external recruitment.

* **ENGAGE AND BE PRESENT.** Represent Petco’s brand and image at a high level through strong culture and positive leadership. Lead our team in a way that is committed to high standards within a fun working environment.

**Education and Experience**

* In addition to a high school diploma or its equivalent (GED), an applicant must be able to demonstrate proficiency in the areas of basic business & finance acumen, analysis and problem-solving skills, and high focus on people development & guest service.
* Excellence in communication and computer skills are also required.
* Three or more years of management experience or the equivalent is required, while previous retail management experience is preferred.
* A working knowledge of general business practices is highly desirable, as are strong organizational skills.
* A qualified applicant will possess an aptitude for demonstrating strong customer service and the ability to instruct others. In addition to having a professional appearance and demeanor, the applicant must also demonstrate a keen and genuine interest in all kinds of animals.
* Must be licensed to operate a motor vehicle. Completion of specific PETCO Management Achievement Program Modules as well as internal management roles may be required for internal candidates.


#LL-LF2

**Supervisory Responsibility**


The General Manager directly supervises a team of leaders and is responsible for all Pet Care Center partners including services.

**Work Environment**


The majority of job duties are conducted indoors, although occasional merchandise stocking, customer carry-outs, and bank deposits will require that an employee leave the Pet Care Center briefly. Because this position requires bending, kneeling, moving merchandise (up to 50 pounds, as necessary) and standing for long periods of time, there may be risk of injury resulting from failure to follow safety precautions and procedures. A limited amount of travel will be required.

**Contacts**

This position has continuous contact with the general public at the Pet Care Center and at Pet Care Center -related events, and regular contact and exchange of information with other departments in the field, Distribution Centers, and at the Support Centers. Contact outside of PETCO may be required in order to coordinate merchandise returns, ordering parts, Pet Care Center repairs, coordination of vaccination clinics, Pet Care Center events, vendor meetings, etc.


Petco Animal Supplies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or any other protected classification.

These ranges may differ in other areas and could be subject to variation based on regulatory minimum wage requirements. Actual pay rates will depend on factors such as position, location, level of experience, and applicable state or local minimum wage laws. If the regulatory minimum wage exceeds the minimum indicated in the pay range below, the regulatory minimum wage will be the minimum rate applied.*


$61,880.00 - $101,400.00
/ year

title: Visual Merchandiser
description:

The ideal Visual Merchandiser is a creative individual who has a passion for presenting the latest fashion trends by crafting eye-catching aesthetics.

**A day in the life…**

* Build and maintain knowledge of visual merchandising strategies and current trends
* Partner with department managers to uphold, teach, and maintain all visual standards
* Support merchandising, signing, and implementation of direction at the highest level with the ability to customize as appropriate to your store
* Install and remove trim/window presentations for store promotional events
* Support successful execution of the in store lighting program
* The hours and schedule for this position will vary by week depending on business needs

**You own this if you have…**

* Experience in merchandising and styling with knowledge of current fashion trends and styles
* A high level of accuracy and attention to detail
* Basic construction skills in building and assembly of visual props preferred
* The ability to use ladders, drills, box knives, and other miscellaneous tools

title: Union Warehouse Associate
description:
**Job Description:**

Since 1953, Ferguson has been a source of quality supplies for a variety of industries. Together We Build Better infrastructure, better homes and better businesses. We exist to make our customers’ complex projects simple, successful, and sustainable. We proactively solve problems, adapt and grow to continuously serve our customers, communities and each other. Ferguson is proud to provide best-in-class products, service and capabilities across the following industries: Commercial/Mechanical, Facilities Supply, Fire and Fabrication, HVAC, Industrial, Residential Trade, Residential Building and Remodel, Waterworks and Residential Digital Commerce. Ferguson has approximately 36,000 associates across 1,700 locations. Ferguson is a community of proud associates who operate with the shared purpose of building something meaningful. You will build a career that you are proud of, at a company you can believe in.


Ferguson is currently seeking a Union Warehouse Associate to join our team!

**The pay rate for this role is $19 hourly and the schedule is Monday - Friday 7am-4pm**

**Responsibilities:**

* Safely operate a stand-up forklift (order selector/cherry picker) to pull and prepare outbound customer orders.
* Build, wrap, sort, and transport pallets and packages.
* Use technology like RF devices to sort, scan, and prepare orders.
* Accurately and timely receive, verify, stage and stock all incoming material.
* Clean the workspace as you go and participate with the team in keeping our facility clean, safe, and accident free.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma/GED or equivalent education.
* 0-5 years warehouse experience in shipping, receiving, delivery, or inventory management is preferred.
* High attention to detail.
* Comfortable in a fast paced, changing environment.
* Positive demeanor, dependability, and strong work ethic.
* Self-starter with ability to learn our systems quickly.
* Ability to lift items that weigh up to 50lbs regularly.
* Knowledge of safety regulations and procedures.
* Continued focus on improving system efficiencies and business practices.


\\*Pre-employment drug and background screening required\\*


We are dedicated to providing meaningful benefits programs and products to our associates and their families. We offer competitive health insurance, paid time off, and more!

* 

*The Company is an equal opportunity employer as well as a government contractor that shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-300.5(a), which prohibits discrimination against qualified protected Veterans and the requirements of 41 CFR 60-741.5(A), which prohibits discrimination against qualified individuals on the basis of disability.*

*Ferguson Enterprises, LLC. is an equal employment employer* *F/M/Disability/Vet/Sexual* *Orientation/Gender* *Identity.*

title: Administrator
description:
**Overview:**

Fifth Season Investments, a Stamford, CT based investment firm specializing in life insurance backed assets, is seeking a Administrator to support the Closing Department with administerial duties involved in the consummation of financial transactions. The Closing Administrator will be vital in ensuring the timely closing of acquisitions and will report directly to the firm’s Sr. Managing Director and VP of Closing.

**Responsibilities:**

· Prepare and review documents necessary to effectuate changes on life insurance policies

· Liaise with insurance carriers to obtain policy information and updates on pending requests

· Coordinate execution of ancillary documents related to the purchase of life insurance policies

· Organize and maintain the closing department’s electronic file repository

· Support senior team members and management on ad-hoc projects

**Desired Skills:** 

· Strong attention to detail

· Excellent time management and organizational skills

· Ability to multi-task and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment

· Superb interpersonal, written, and communication skills

· Proficiency in Microsoft Office product suite and Adobe Acrobat, experience with Salesforce and DocuSign preferred

**Qualifications:**

· 4-year Bachelor’s degree preferred

· Basic knowledge of life insurance products and/or experience in the life insurance industry is a plus, but not required

**Compensation and Benefits:** 

· Competitive base salary [$50k-$60k]

· Participation (after requisite waiting periods) in firm’s medical, dental, vision, FSA and 401k plans

· Modern office with sit/stand desks and multi-monitor setup

· Corporate events, including team outings, dinners and company sporting events

title: NAPA Automotive Counter Sales Rep | FT
description:
Company Overview:



Quick Auto Parts Dist. was founded in a barn in Hicksville NY, in 1960. In 1971, a second store, Concord Auto Parts was opened, also in Hicksville. Today, after nearly 65 years of being in business, both stores are owned and run by the family’s third generation. We attribute our many years of success to our dedicated employees and valued customers. We have a culture of promoting from within. We are very proud that the average length of employment for 2/3 of our staff is almost 22 years!

  



Our business is primarily wholesale, but we have a loyal base of retail and DIY customers as well.



We offer a competitive salary, health benefits, and opportunities for growth within the company.



This position is a great opportunity to join our team! Auto Parts Counter Salespeople are the backbone of our business, delivering excellent customer service and knowledge to our long-standing customers.



If you have a passion for providing great customer service and for the automotive industry, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

  



Counter Sales:



Primary responsibilities include:


* Provide wholesale and retail customers with answers and solutions to their auto parts questions and needs, either in person or on the telephone


* Identify and locate parts for customers using our computer system as well as other suppliers’ cataloging sites.


* Handle cash and other purchasing transactions


* Effectively communicate features, benefits and warranty policy information to customers.


* Demonstrate a positive, helpful attitude as well as professional conduct and appearance at all times.


* Collaborate with other team members to fulfill customer orders in a timely manner.


* Maintain a clean and organized work area.



Required skills include:


* Prior automotive background or knowledge.


* Enjoy working with people in a busy and fast-paced environment



Bilingual is not a requirement but would be considered a benefit.



Benefits:


* Competitive pay, starting at $45,000 annually DOE


* Paid Sick and vacation time


* Health insurance benefits with top rated companies


* Matching 401K plan



Schedule:


* The Job is for a 5-day week, Mon - Sat and Saturdays are required. Sat store hours are 8-2, M -F 8:00 - 6:00

**Essential Job Functions**

· Provide rehabilitation services including Assertiveness/Self-Advocacy Training, Community Integration/Resource Development, Daily Living Skills Training, Health Services, Medication Management and Training, Rehabilitation Counseling, Skill Development Services, Socialization, Substance Abuse Prevention Services, and Symptom Management.

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
Under the supervision of the Director of Finance, the Human Resources Manager is responsible for promoting and implementing human resource values by planning and managing all components of HR administration. The HR Manager will effectively plan, design, develop, and evaluate human resource-related initiatives. The HR Manager will promote the use of the Nurtured Heart Approach© in all activities with the goal of promoting a safe and comfortable environment for all individuals within the CGE community and within all business relationships.

The schedule for this role is Monday-Friday, 9:00am to 5:00pm.

PERFORMANCE STANDARDS:

1.) Perform all duties and demonstrate behaviors and attitudes consistent with the Mission Statement and Core Values of the organization, and the Nurtured Heart Approach©.

2.) Continually participate in building and maintaining positive working relationships through effective communication, performance improvement and teamwork efforts.

3.) Be of good character and reputation; sufficient physical, mental, and emotional health to satisfactorily perform her or his job duties.

4.) Actively participate in safety programs of the organization by identifying potential risks and promoting client safety as well as environmental safety.

5.) Accomplish individual and team goals and objectives established by supervisor based on prior performance evaluation.

6.) Comply with HIPAA guidelines regarding client rights and confidentiality.

7.) Comply with documentation and training set forth by Human Resources.

8.) Actively participate in CGE's clinical research efforts by ensuring accurate and timely reporting for all assessments and evaluations.

LEADERSHIP:

* Provide oversight and leadership to HR staff, establishing and maintaining clear goals and objectives while fostering departmental teamwork and collaboration.
* Ensure timely and accurate human resources activities are attended to including but not limited to; full-cycle talent acquisition, staff engagement, retention and performance management, employment processing, compensation, benefits and leaves administration, records management, safety and health promotion, employee relations matters, and ensuring compliance with all applicable local, State and Federal employment laws as well as external regulatory requirements.
* Ensure that all HR records are maintained accurately and completely at all times.
* Oversee employee training program that evaluates and addresses agency needs, including new employee orientation, and external regulatory requirements.
* Contribute to the ongoing development of a high-performance culture that emphasizes empowerment that is trauma informed.
* Monitor adherence to annual budget that includes human resources services, employee recognition, and administration.
* Ensure agency-wide awareness and adherence to Ethical Code of Conduct and other employment policies.
* Participate in human resources counsel and decisions.
* Guide management and employee actions by researching, developing, writing, and updating policies and procedures, and communicating and enforcing organizational values.
* Comply with federal, state, and local legal requirements by studying existing and new legislation and enforcing adherence to requirements.
* Participate in conferences, job fairs, and professional networks/organizations that support internal workflow and increase agency’s external presence.
* Oversee and utilize human resource information software (HRIS) for appropriate record keeping and management practices.

OTHER:

* Build and maintain strong working relationships with all CGE staff and supervisors.
* Work as a member of a team to establish and maintain a high level of care and respect for, and communication with, community leadership and external customers.
* Work in a consistently professional manner at all times, which includes, but is not limited to, treating all clients, staff, and guests and volunteers with dignity and respect.
* Implement emergency procedures as necessary.
* Ensure proper handling and confidentiality of all sensitive employee information.
* Perform other duties as directed.

QUALIFICATIONS:

* Bachelor’s degree in human resources or equivalent experience.
* At least 5 years of experience in the HR field.
* At least 2 years of experience in a supervisory role.
* Experience in the behavioral health field is a plus.
* SHRM certified professional a plus.
* Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills with friendly and professional demeanor.
* Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
* Strong organizational, project management and problem-solving skills with impeccable multi-tasking abilities.
* Team-player outlook.
* Passion for CGE’s mission and purpose and an ability to communicate this passion to others.
* Ability to be flexible to the daily changing needs within the community and to handle obstacles with compassion and resolve.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Dental Assistant/ Dental Surgical Assistant (Part-Time or Full-Time)
description:
**About Smile Again NJ:**

Smile Again is a boutique dental implant center known for providing exceptional dental reconstructive services with a personalized approach. Our patients benefit from a seamless, continuous care experience, knowing the same dedicated team will support them from consultation through treatment completion. Every staff member contributes to creating an outstanding patient journey.

Traditionally, dental implant procedures required multiple visits to various specialists, with teeth crafted at off-site labs. At Smile Again, we’ve simplified the process by offering all essential components for successful dental implant treatments in-house. From consultation and treatment planning to surgery, restorative care, and on-site teeth creation, we deliver everything in one convenient location.

**Position Overview:**

· Full time Dental Assistant/ Dental Surgical Assistant needed to assist a thriving Prosthodontics Dental Implant Center. Personal and professional development opportunities and prospects for growth. Must be motivated, passionate and focused on patient quality of care.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Chairside Assistance**: Assist the oral surgeon and/or prosthodontist in all chairside tasks related to dental implant surgical and restorative procedures.
* **Procedure Support**: Assist in the set-up, administration, cleanup, and recording of procedures under local anesthesia, nitrous sedation, and IV sedation.
* **Instrument Handling**: Pass dental instrumentation and dental implant parts and components to the oral surgeon and/or prosthodontist.
* **Patient Care**: Provide pre- and post-operative care and instructions to patients.
* **Impressions, Scanning, and X-rays**: Prepare materials for impressions, computer for intraoral 3D scanning, and take dental x-rays as directed (if certified).
* **Sterilization and Disinfection**: Sterilize and disinfect instruments and equipment and prepare trays of instruments for procedures.
* **Health and Safety Compliance**: Be familiar with and comply with all Health and Safety rules and guidelines on infection control.
* **Office Duties**: Perform additional office duties as needed, including scheduling and receiving patients, ordering supplies, and records management.
* **Additional Duties**: Perform additional duties as assigned per state regulations or licensing requirements.

**Qualifications:**

· Prior dental assisting experience is required (2yrs)

· Strong organizational and interpersonal skills

· Proficient computer skills (we are a fully digital practice that uses software for treatment and records)

· A valid driver’s license (due to limited access to public transportation)

**Compensation:**

Competitive compensation. Salary and benefits will be commensurate with experience and qualifications. Opportunities for growth as the Center grows.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Expected hours: 30 – 40 per week

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* No weekends

Experience:

* Dental assisting: 2 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Fairfield, NJ 07004 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Credit Free Healthcare Instructors
description:
**Credit-Free Healthcare instructor (EKG, Phlebotomy, Medical Billing and Coding, and Medical Assistant)**


This is a part-time instructor role for credit-free healthcare programs. As an instructor, this position will be expected to provide training through a variety of modalities, including online and in-person. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in healthcare training and working with employers in the field. This role is expected to create and provide a syllabus for students, adhere to the curriculum for the class, assess student learning, and maintain a positive learning environment.


This position reports to the Assistant Director of Workforce Innovation and Instructional Coordination.


Responsibilities

* Provide classroom instruction to adult credit-free Patient Care Technician students utilizing an approved training curriculum and materials
* Deliver lectures using up-to-date hands-on techniques
* Knowledge of best practices in the field
* Plan, prepare, and deliver approved curriculum
* Plan and organize instructional materials/supply inventories/tools/equipment (notify lack of supplies in a timely manner)
* Prepare lesson plans
* Provide and maintain a clean environment after each class
* Track and report student grades and attendance
* Lead, inspire, motivate, and advise students to actively participate in all aspects of their educational process
* Provide regular, accurate, and timely feedback to students and the school concerning academics, behavior, and poor attendance
* Participate in professional development trainings
* Other duties as assigned

  

Qualifications

* Minimum of an Associate’s Degree required
* National Health Association (NHA) Certification
* Have a proven track record in assisting students successfully pass the NHA exam
* Must have a minimum of 3-5 years of hands-on experience in the field and teaching EKG, Phlebotomy, Medical Billing and Coding and or Medical Assistant
* Must be able to develop and maintain excellent relationships with a diverse staff and student population
* Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
* Consistently demonstrate the highest levels of integrity
* Possess strong interpersonal skills
* The ability to work effectively with and support students from diverse backgrounds
* Maintain a strong presence and have excellent skills in teaching
* A flexible schedule, mornings, evenings, and or weekends
* Proficient in Microsoft Office (i.e Word, Excel, Teams, etc)
* Must be highly organized and detail-oriented
* Excellent organizational skills
* Passion for education and a commitment to student success

  

Salary Range: $40-$55 per hour depending upon degree attainment


Time Commitment: The part-time contract is estimated for 29 hours a week maximum

title: HR and Administrative Assistant
description:
**Job Title:** HR and Admin Assistant

**Location:** Princeton, NJ

**Job Type:** Temp to Hire

**Role overview:**

We are seeking a dedicated HR and Admin Assistant to support Management in various administrative tasks related to business. The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented, organized, and possess excellent communication skills. This role requires the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a high level of professionalism and confidentiality.

**Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with the HR team to post job openings on various recruitment portals and social media platforms, ensuring maximum visibility for available positions.
* Conduct initial interviews with candidates via video conferencing, following a structured format provided by the HR team. Assist in assessing candidate suitability based on predetermined criteria.
* Work closely with the HR team to create and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for various positions. Keep track of candidate interactions and update candidate status in the applicant tracking system.
* Assist in coordinating interview schedules between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring timely communication and efficient interview processes.
* Collaborate with HR team members to create detailed and accurate job descriptions for open positions, highlighting key responsibilities, qualifications, and expectations.
* Actively participate in talent acquisition meetings and discussions, providing input and assistance as needed. Contribute ideas for improving recruitment processes and attracting top talent.
* Provide general administrative support Management, including but not limited to filing, data entry, and organizing documents and records.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field preferred.
* Prior experience in HR or recruitment is a plus.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and familiarity with applicant tracking systems.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively.
* Proactive attitude and willingness to take on new challenges.
* Attention to detail and accuracy in all tasks.

title: Fitness Center Attendant & Lifeguard
description:
The Wright Fit
  
  

**The Pathway to an Extraordinary Quality of Life:** The Wright Fit has established itself as the premier Luxury Fitness and Amenities Management Company operating 24 and counting facilities in some of the most iconic residential and commercial buildings in Manhattan. By managing the facilities within residential and commercial buildings, we're given direct access into people's homes and workplaces, allowing us the opportunity to show them pathways to an extraordinary quality of life.
  
  

Job Summary
  
  

**The Wright Fit Team:**  

As an emerging leader in the fitness industry, there's no better place to gain first-hand experience at the crossroads of hospitality, health, wellness, and fitness. If you are a self-starter, customer focused, and a team player with a passion for fitness, then The Wright Fit is the right fit for you!
  
  

**Your Impact:**  

Our Luxury Fitness Center Attendants are responsible for delivering the highest quality customer service to all residents and guests through effective communication and extensive knowledge of The Wright Fit services and holistic approaches. Through relationship development, they will be able to proactively meet the needs of residents and guests and provide them with a platform to succeed!
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Provide high level customer service and hospitality to clients.
* Provide floor supervision and maintenance of the fitness center and equipment.
* Assist clients with any questions about the fitness center through knowledge of the equipment and services.
* Coordinate Personal training and other fitness services.
* Provide support to The Wright Fit specialists to ensure best service experience.
* Assist in organizing and managing events at the fitness center.
* Attentively and promptly respond to client's needs.
* Assist management in daily tasks and projects.
* Maintain a positive attitude and take initiative.
* Work as a cohesive team with all The Wright Fit team members to ensure efficiency and camaraderie.
* Maintain in conduct and actions The Wright Fit aesthetic, appearance, atmosphere, culture, vision, purpose and values.
* Compliance with quality assurance expectations and standards that may require you to sit, stand, or walk for extended periods of time, as well as lift and move heavy objects.


**What we're looking for:**  

* Administrative or Customer Service experience, preferably in Hospitality and/or Fitness.
* A passion for fitness, health, and wellness.
* Strong interpersonal, communication, and organization skills.
* Customer focused, able to manage conflict.
* Excellent time management, able to multi-task in a dynamic environment.
* Attention to detail, a self-starter and personally accountable.
* A positive attitude, team oriented.
* Ability to maintain the highest level of discretion and privacy.
* Attend and pass internal lifeguard certification.


**What you'll get:**  

* A supportive and passionate team of coworkers.
* Encouraging managers and leaders to learn from.
* Access to cutting edge information about the industry.


**Salary Range:** $19.00/Hourly
  
  

The Wright Fit is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. The Wright Fit does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected under federal, state, or local laws.

title: Server with good wine and fine food exposure
description:
Here at Plancha Tapas and Wine Bar, we are expanding and looking for FULL-TIME or PART-TIME server/bartender. Your passion for great food, amazing wine, and genuine hospitality is very important for us. Check our listing on https://www.yelp.com/biz/plancha-tapas-and-wine-bar-garden-city and see our work on https://www.instagram.com/barplancha - and you will see that we love what we do.

Ideally, you are an experienced service professional with solid knowledge of wine varieties and fine food dining. Prior restaurant, cafe, diner or pizzeria experience are all relevant and useful. If you have not been exposed to wine, but you have in-depth knowledge of beer, coffee, cheeses, etc. - it's good too.

No restaurant background? We are willing to train a right person. For people with industry experience, we are looking for someone with GOOD knowledge of WINE and FINE FOOD and FULL availability. If you are a wine aficionado and/or a passionate foodie who has nights, weekends, and holidays availability, we would be happy to interview you.

To schedule an interview, send an email telling us about yourself and why you might be a good fit for working with us. Please mention your exposure to wine and fine food, location, and availability.

The vibe is hip, foody, and fun. If you are from Floral Park, Franklin Square, Malverne, Lynbrook, New Hyde Park, Mineola, Rockville Centre, Baldwin, East Meadow, Westbury, Carle Place, Levittown, Hicksville, Wantagh, Bellmore, Seaford, or Salisbury and interested in working at Plancha, contact us.

title: Reinsurance Claim Examiner II
description:
Title:
Reinsurance Claim Examiner II
Company:
Everest Global Services, Inc.
Job Category:
Claims
Job Description:
About Everest:  

Everest Group, Ltd. (Everest), is a leading global reinsurance and insurance provider, operating for nearly 50 years through subsidiaries in North America, Latin America, the UK & Ireland, Continental Europe and Asia Pacific regions. Throughout our history, Everest has maintained its discipline and focuses on creating long-term value through underwriting excellence and strong risk and capital management. Our strengths include extensive product and distribution capabilities, a strong balance sheet, and an innovative culture. Our most critical asset is our people. We offer dynamic training & professional development to our employees. We also offer generous tuition/continuing education reimbursement programs, mentoring opportunities, flexible work arrangements, and Colleague Resource Groups.
About the Role:
Everest Global Services, a member of Everest Re Group, Ltd., is seeking a Reinsurance Claims Examiner II for its headquarters in Warren, New Jersey on a hybrid work schedule (3 days in office/2 days remote). The ideal candidate will have 3+ years of commercial claim handling experience and possess solid coverage, damage evaluation, claims resolution and customer service skills.
Role & Responsibilities (include but not limited to):* Manage a caseload of commercial casualty claims including CGL, Professional Lines and Auto Liability.
* Maintain strong client focus by aggressively and proactively researching issues, providing support, and assuring client satisfaction in a timely fashion.
* Support underwriting team needs for claim information and consultation on coverage.
* Evaluate and settle claims, applying technical knowledge and people skills to effect fair and prompt claim resolution.
* Complete detailed reviews of claim related issues, including coverage, liability and damage and document the claim file appropriately.
* Set and maintain appropriate and timely indemnity and expense reserves.
* Conduct claim reviews as necessary.
* Interact with internal and external clients related to claim matters associated with assigned accounts.
* Some travel required.


Work Experience and Qualifications* 3+ years of commercial claims handling experience.
* Excellent customer service skills, building and maintaining relationships with underwriters, brokers, and internal and external clients.
* Experience with handling claims in a paperless environment
* Strong insurance background with an understanding of insurance business concepts.
* Reinsurance claims experience a plus, onsite training provided.
* Excellent organization and analytical skills are essential.
* Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills are required.
* Must be self-motivated and can work in a collaborative team environment.
* Interest in developing leadership and management skills.
* Interest in data and data analytics a plus.


Our Culture
At Everest, our purpose is to provide the world with protection. We help clients and businesses thrive, fuel global economies, and create sustainable value for our colleagues, shareholders and the communities that we serve. We also pride ourselves on having a unique and inclusive culture which is driven by a unified set of values and behaviors. Click here to learn more about our culture.* Our Values are the guiding principles that inform our decisions, actions and behaviors. They are an expression of our culture and an integral part of how we work: Talent. Thoughtful assumption of risk. Execution. Efficiency. Humility. Leadership. Collaboration. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion.
* Our Colleague Behaviors define how we operate and interact with each other no matter our location, level or function: Respect everyone. Pursue better. Lead by example. Own our outcomes. Win together.

  

All colleagues are held accountable to upholding and supporting our values and behaviors across the company. This includes day to day interactions with fellow colleagues, and the global communities we serve.
#LI-Hybrid
#LI-CK1
Type:
Regular
Time Type:
Full time
Primary Location:
Warren, NJ
Additional Locations:*Everest is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or creed, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, genetics, physical or mental disability, age, marital status, civil union status, family or parental status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. As part of this commitment, Everest will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact Everest Benefits at* *everestbenefits@everestglobal.com.*

title: Client Service Representative
description:
We are seeking a Client Service Representative to join our team.  

At VCA Animal Hospitals, we take our mission statement – your pet’s health is our top priority and excellent service is our goal – very seriously. With every opportunity, we aim to exceed each pet owner’s expectations.  

We’re looking for a personable yet highly professional “service extraordinaire” to join us in delivering our mission to our clients and their pets.  

  

Why We Need You  

As the face of VCA, the Client Service Representative sets the tone for the practice as we build and maintain each customer's trust and confidence in our abilities. The CSR is the pivot around which the hospital operates and is responsible for:  

* Customer service functions, including: greeting visitors, answering telephones, and guiding clients and their pets to exam rooms.
* Scheduling and confirming appointments.
* Placing outbound calls for follow-ups and reaching out to prospective clients.
* Presenting and explaining fees, including processing payments.
* Recommending, selecting, and obtaining products and services, including prescriptions.
* Answering questions regarding products and services, including educating clients on general animal husbandry and non-medical pet care (i.e., heartworm prevention, housebreaking, and flea & tick control).
* Managing medical records, charts, reports and correspondence.
* Hospital maintenance (including removal of animal waste) and ensuring that facility is neat and clean at all times—both inside and outside.

  

Benefits  

We offer competitive compensation and great benefits, including, medical/dental/vision and paid vacation (for F/T employees only), 401(k), generous personal pet care discounts, and more!**If you are a current associate, you will need to apply through our internal career site. Please log into Workday and click on the Jobs Hub app or search for Browse Jobs.**


Benefits: We offer competitive compensation along with a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision and paid vacation/sick days, 401(k), generous employee pet discounts and more!  

  

The information in this position description indicates the general nature and level of work to be performed. It is not designed to be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of associates assigned to this job. Management reserves the right to revise the job description or require that other tasks be performed when the circumstances of the job change (for example, emergencies, change in personnel, workload, or technical development)  

  

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer - Veterans / Disabled. For a complete EEO statement please see our career page at vcacareers.com
company_description: A leader in veterinary care, VCA Animal Hospitals is committed to taking care of the future of veterinary medicine.

title: Associate Civil Engineering Inspector (PE Track)
description:
20/20 provides expert engineering building solutions covering the Tri-State area for all required and applicable city, national and international code testing and inspections. We are an established construction and engineering inspection firm renowned for our work on high-profile projects throughout these boroughs. Our professional services go beyond the day-to-day application of ensuring safety and building code compliance. Our technical team further enhances our industry specific needs with specialty and other out of the ordinary services.

Our state-of-the-art laboratory is meticulously operated with accuracy, precision and equipment that has the capacity to service large scale, intricate or unique projects.  
We partner with design professionals throughout the development, planning and construction phases of a project to facilitate their understanding, interpretation and application of code. Such collaboration results in a cohesive, well-planned and sustainable path to a successful project.

We are seeking a full-time Engineer-in-Training (EIT) for projects throughout the Bronx, Brooklyn, Queens, and Manhattan.

Pay: $28.00 – $35.00 per hour

**ABOUT THE JOB:**

**Opportunity**: Are you an Engineer-in-Training (EIT) with a passion for civil engineering and a goal of becoming a Professional Engineer (PE)? Join our team as a Civil Engineer Inspector and gain hands-on experience while working towards your PE license!

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Conduct inspections of civil engineering projects to ensure adherence to standards and specifications.
* Prepare detailed inspection reports.
* Collaborate with project managers, clients, and contractors.

**What We Offer:**

* **Mentorship**: Guidance from experienced PE professionals to help you achieve your licensing goals.

title: Elementary/Middle School Math Teacher
description:
**Math Teachers Wanted for Fun After-School Tutoring!** Sylvan Learning Center is looking for fun, dedicated teachers to help and inspire students. We are currently looking for teachers who are able to teach K-6 math. K-8 (or above, including Integrated/Algebra 1+) is strongly preferred.


Sylvan creates individualized learning plans for students of all abilities. Working with well-behaved groups of only three students, you will be responsible for leading instruction and motivating students to be successful. There is no lesson plan to create, no homework to grade, no parent-conferencing, and scheduling is flexible. Enjoy all of the benefits of teaching, without any of the downsides!

**What you should know:**

* You will use pre-planned lessons. They are straightforward, easy to manage, and fun to teach.
* Teach students in a small group setting. There will be no more than 3 students per teacher.
* Most teachers choose to work 2-5 days/week
* We are open for instruction weekday afternoons and Saturday mornings.
* **This is NOT a remote position**

**Job Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree required, Teaching Credential required
* You must enjoy teaching, working, and inspiring students. (We want you to be happy here!)
* Being punctual is extremely important. You must be local and have reliable transportation.
* Strong knowledge of K-6 math. Knowledge of Algebra 1 (or higher) strongly preferred.
* Authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive Pay
* Paid training and opportunities for professional development.
* Flexible part-time work hours. We work around your availability!
* Come in, work for a couple of hours, and leave happy with no additional work to take home!
* Fun, enjoyable, and relaxing work environment with lots of support from fellow teachers and staff!
* Happy, understanding, and caring management. You will love working here!


Since 1995, Sylvan Learning of East Brunswick has been inspiring students to succeed in school and in life. We are currently seeking teachers to work with students at our location. At Sylvan, there are no lesson plans to make and no papers to grade. Our teachers get to just teach and enjoy spending time with students, doing the work they love without the stress of administrative work and parent meetings.  

Currently, Sylvan has openings for Elementary, Middle School, and High School Reading, Writing, and Math teachers. The programs that Sylvan offers are aligned to the Common Core Standards. All lessons are provided to the instructor, so no planning is required. All Sylvan instructors are expected to have knowledge in their content area, good communication skills and enjoy working with students, while motivating them through positive reinforcement.


Pay: $18 - $21 / hour


Job Type: parttime


Education: Bachelor's degree


Work location: On-site

title: Director, Producer/Editor with Animation Skills
description:
Director, Producer/Editor with Animation Skills


**Requisition ID:** 47081
**Business Unit:** Fitch Group
**Category:** Marketing & Communications
**Location:**New York, NY, US
**Date Posted:** Sep 16, 2024  

**Director, Producer/Editor with Animation Skills**  


**Fitch Ratings** is currently seeking a **Producer/Editor with Animation Skills** based out of our **New York** office.  


**Overview:** Fitch Ratings is looking for a client-facing, hands-on, video producer/editor (PREDITOR) with camera, lighting, studio, and editing/post-production skills to join its growing Multimedia team. This newly created position will function as part of a global team to develop multimedia content to strengthen the company’s market presence with the goal of building brand awareness, increasing market share, and maximizing revenues across Fitch’s brands, products, and services.  


**What We Offer:**
* Great development opportunity within a growing Multimedia team
* High visibility role with impactful contributions
* Amazing team and collaborative work environment
* Competitive benefits and a hybrid work model with 3 core days in the NYC Office

  


**We’ll Count on You To:**
* Responsible for the day-to-day provisioning of video and audio recording in the New York studio, as well as location and remote shoots
* Operate cameras, set up lighting, conduct general videography work, and handle audio recordings as necessary, including the maintenance of studio equipment
* Produce, record, and edit engaging short-form videos, podcasts, animated videos, and multimedia content for company website(s) and various social media platforms
* Generate ideas and develop multimedia content in support of strategic campaigns to drive awareness and generate leads across the Fitch Group businesses
* Analyze, monitor, and report on the effectiveness of video performance and provide insights and recommendations to stakeholders
* Collaborate with other global team members and stakeholders, including Subject Matter Experts, Designers, Marketers, Business Executives, and other internal/external stakeholders in a client-facing capacity

  


**What You Need to Have:**
* Degree in television, radio, film, sound, and other new media areas and 7 years of professional experience in a related industry
* Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, especially Premiere, After Effects, and Audition
* Experience with an enterprise-level CMS, Brightcove is a plus
* Strong mastery of camera operation skills, knowledge in green-screen lighting filming, and ENG field shoots. Experience with remote capture applications a plus.

  


**What Would Make You Stand Out:**
* B2B financial services and experience bringing very complex concepts to life
* Experience with new and emergent AI platforms
* Strong conceptual thinker with the ability to prioritize, execute, and manage multiple projects at one time
* Candidates with high proficiency in motion graphics and infographic design will be given first consideration
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills (English), fluency in Spanish a plus
* Personal network of vetted crew contacts and video resources in the region that can be called upon for projects
* Strong time management skills and an entrepreneurial spirit
* **Demo reel required.** Candidate should be prepared to discuss in detail

  


**Why Fitch?**  


At Fitch Group, the combined power of our global perspectives is what differentiates us. Our global network of colleagues comes together to accomplish things greater than they ever could alone.  

Every team member is essential to our business and each perspective is critical to our success. We embrace a diverse culture that encourages a free exchange of ideas, guaranteeing your voice will be heard and your work will have an impact, regardless of seniority.  


We are building incredible things at Fitch and we invite you to join us on our journey.  

Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Wholly owned by the Hearst Corporation, we are comprised of three main businesses: Fitch Ratings | Fitch Solutions | Fitch Learning.  


For more information please visit our websites  


Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest.  


Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will be asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts prior to commencing employment. If you, or your immediate family, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, you may be asked to divest yourself of them before beginning work.  


Fitch Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluatequalified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.  


**FOR NEW YORK ROLES ONLY:** Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $85,000 and $125,000 per year. Actual salaries will be determined on an individualized basis and may vary based on factors including but not limited to education, training, experience, past performance, and other job-related factors. Base pay is one part of Fitch’s total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, discretionary bonuses, long-term incentives, and other benefits sponsored by Fitch.

title: Associate Director, Corporate Communications
description:
Associate Director, Corporate Communications


**Requisition ID:** 47111
**Business Unit:** Fitch Group
**Category:** Marketing & Communications
**Location:**New York, NY, US
**Date Posted:** Sep 16, 2024  

**Associate Director, Corporate Communications**  


**About the role:**  


The Fitch Group Corporate Communications team is currently seeking an Associate Director-level candidate for a Press Officer role based in New York, supporting media activities throughout the US, Canada and Latin America. The candidate will be responsible for optimizing media visibility for Fitch Ratings and our Fitch Solutions businesses.  


As part of an integrated team, you will also work closely with specialists in marketing, internal communications, content distribution and web teams to deliver optimal visibility for a range of stakeholders. We seek to optimize Fitch's visibility through topical, timely and effective communications delivered with strategic focus and strong operating discipline. This is a fantastic opportunity to learn and develop in a fast-paced and supportive working environment.  


Reporting to a NY based senior director of communications, the candidate will work closely with colleagues across the globe in a highly-effective team which manages relationships with print, broadcast and financial markets journalists, as well as protecting the reputation and position of Fitch.  


This position is based at Hearst Tower in New York City.  


**What we offer:**
* A team-oriented work environment.
* Career growth and development opportunities.
* Opportunity to make a meaningful impact at a leading global financial information services company with operations in over 30 countries. This role focuses on protecting and advancing the firm's reputation by collaborating with diverse global media.

  


**We’ll count on you to:**
* Work closely with Fitch Ratings analytical groups, commercial facing teams for Ratings and Solutions businesses, as well as marketing leaders representing various businesses to develop proactive communications strategies to enhance visibility in the media and relationships with reporters.
* Provide effective media relations counsel to senior management within Fitch Ratings and Fitch Solutions, collaboration with senior directors on the Americas communications team.
* Contribute to the development of Fitch’s global media strategy
* Identify media opportunities including editorial calendars, topical themes, journalist moves and emerging trends
* Ensure broad, timely and relevant distribution of news about rating decisions, product developments and industry commentary.
* Write media releases based on research reports and develop other media collateral such as media pitches, reactive comments and social media posts related to Fitch news and media coverage.
* Deal directly with broadcast, print, online and specialist reporters to ensure the optimal positioning of Fitch research and commentary.
* Respond to media enquiries and proactively engage with the media, as appropriate.
* Develop strong relationships with beat reporters covering the relevant analytical groups and businesses.
* Ensure regular interaction for analytical team members and senior management (as relevant) with media.
* Develop core messages for significant initiatives and press interviews.
* Contribute to media relations strategic planning for analytical groups and businesses supported.
* Provide cover support for other colleagues during busy periods or if they are away.
* Help compile Fitch’s daily internal media coverage reports in the Americas, which features prominent media mentions in key media.
* Support the work of Corporate Communications colleagues, contributing to the firm’s broader strategic objectives and projects.
* Assist with ad-hoc corporate communications activities as required.

  


**What you’ll need to have:**  

* A confident self-starter able to work effectively as part of a team but with the ability to operate autonomously without detailed management oversight.
* A strong communicator who can provide effective advice for the benefit of the organization as and when necessary.
* Able to package complex, market-sensitive messages for different audiences.
* Ability to “think globally” – proactively contribute ideas and work collaboratively in an international team.
* Creative thinking that can move beyond existing siloes or systems to potentially reimagine current processes and systems for greater efficiency and effectiveness.

  


**What would make you stand out:**
+ Bachelor’s degree.
+ 7-10 years’ experience in media relations/corporate communications (either agency or in-house) or journalism, preferably in capital markets, financial or professional services.
+ Proven experience of regular dealings with broadcast and print journalists.
+ Strong verbal, writing and interpersonal skills.
+ Fluency in both Spanish and English.
+ Ability to create clear and straightforward content out of complex documents.
+ Experience of operating under pressure in response to short media deadlines.
+ Multi-tasking/project management skills.
+ Familiarity with current and emerging social media trends.
  

**Why Fitch?**  


At Fitch Group, the combined power of our global perspectives is what differentiates us. Our global network of colleagues comes together to accomplish things greater than they ever could alone.  

Every team member is essential to our business and each perspective is critical to our success. We embrace a diverse culture that encourages a free exchange of ideas, guaranteeing your voice will be heard and your work will have an impact, regardless of seniority.  


We are building incredible things at Fitch and we invite you to join us on our journey.  

Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Wholly owned by the Hearst Corporation, we are comprised of three main businesses: Fitch Ratings | Fitch Solutions | Fitch Learning.  


For more information please visit our websites  


Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest.  


Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will be asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts prior to commencing employment. If you, or your immediate family, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, you may be asked to divest yourself of them before beginning work.  


Fitch Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluatequalified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.  


**FOR NEW YORK ROLES ONLY:** Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $80,000 and $110,000 per year. Actual salaries will be determined on an individualized basis and may vary based on factors including but not limited to education, training, experience, past performance, and other job-related factors. Base pay is one part of Fitch’s total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, discretionary bonuses, long-term incentives, and other benefits sponsored by Fitch.

title: Enhance Counselor (P.S.S.1 - 10 Months)
description:
**Description**
---------------


**ABOUT RAMAPO COLLEGE**:


Ramapo College of New Jersey (RCNJ) develops ethical leaders who serve as change agents across all sectors. The College’s unique interdisciplinary academic structure, its liberal arts core, its size (approximately 5,500 students), and its setting in the foothills of the Ramapo Mountains on the New Jersey/New York border provide an optimal environment for individualized, student-centered learning and leadership development. RCNJ’s designation as “New Jersey’s Public Liberal Arts College” by the State legislature is the foundation from which the College’s commitment to an accessible and transformative undergraduate and graduate education is realized.


Established in 1969, *CondeNast Traveler* named Ramapo one of the 50 Most Beautiful College Campuses in America. The barrier-free campus occupies 300 acres and is home to 52 bachelor’s degree programs spanning the arts, business, data science, humanities, education, nursing, social work, social sciences, and the sciences. Ramapo College boasts an average student/faculty ratio of 16:1 and an average class size of 21; affording students the opportunity to develop close ties to the College’s exceptional faculty. In addition, the College offers graduate programs leading to master’s degrees in Accounting, Applied Mathematics, Business Administration, Contemporary Instructional Design, Computer Science, Creative Music Technology, Data Science, Educational Leadership, Nursing, Social Work, and Special Education, as well as a Doctor of Nursing Practice. Every degree program is designed and delivered through the collaborative and interdisciplinary efforts of student-centered faculty scholars and staff who are committed to serving the public good through the delivery of an academically rigorous, inclusive, and a transformative collegiate experience. Ramapo is ranked #1 among New Jersey public institutions by *College Choice* and is recognized as the State’s top college on the list of Best Disability Schools by *Great Value Colleges*. Further commendations include designation as a “Military Friendly College” in *Victory Media’s Guide to Military Friendly Schools*, and as a leading college by *U.S. News & World Report*, *Kiplinger’s*, *Princeton Review,* and *Money* *Magazine*, among others.

**JOB SUMMARY**  

The ENHANCE Counselor, works for the ENHANCE Program which provides additional services to students who are diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD), reports to the Assistant Director of the ENHANCE Program. The ENHANCE Program takes a holistic approach and focuses on social, academic, organizational, and emotional growth to help students with ASD adapt and flourish in college.  

Hours may vary depending on the needs of the department and College and will include certain evening hours and holidays when classes are in session. Occasional weekend work (e.g., College Orientations, First-Year Student Move-in Day, Admitted Students Day) will be required. **SALARY RANGE**  

**This is a 10 month position**  

**AFT - U24 - Steps 1-3 - $71,400 -$78,537**  

  

**Internal Applicants salary will be based on union contract negotiations**  


**Examples of Duties**
----------------------


**DUTIES*** Conducts individual weekly counseling sessions with the students in the ENHANCE program
* Leads/Co-leads weekly group therapy meetings
* Oversees and supervises weekly social events
* Assists the Assistant Director with providing on-going supervision to peer mentors
* Assists the Assistant Director with administrative components of the program such as intervening with faculty members when students have difficulties, consulting with parents, having phone meetings with parents regarding prospective students, etc.
* Creates and facilitates weekly academic/executive functioning workshops
* Assists with interviewing and assessing for acceptance into the ENHANCE program
* Provides training to student groups, faculty, and professional staff regarding working with students with ASD
* Chaperone off-campus social events
* Other duties as assigned

**Qualifications**
------------------


**EDUCATION**
Minimum requirements - Master’s degree in mental health related field. License-eligible in NJ (supervision provided).  

Preferred requirements - licensed Master level professional with degree in mental health, psychology, or social work (LCSW, LPC) or Doctoral degree in Clinical or Counseling Psychology. New Jersey licensed or license-eligible (supervision provided) as a psychologist will be considered. If applicant is a psychologist, NJ licensure will be required prior to eligibility of the first multi-year contract.
.**EXPERIENCE**


Minimum four years of counseling experience, one of which must be with working with a young adult population who have a diagnosis of Autism Spectrum Disorder
A Doctoral degree may be substituted for two years of required work experience.
Preferred experience working with college student populations
 Preferred experience in conducting educational workshops on executive functioning skills, study skills, time management and organization **ADDITIONAL KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES*** Demonstrated strong clinical skills essential
* Experience with culturally diverse populations
* Good interpersonal skills
* Preferred experience leading workshops
* Preferred experience in teaching social skills groups
* Excellent written and oral communication skills

**Supplemental Information**
----------------------------


**EEO Statement:**  

Ramapo College is an Affirmative Action/Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Ramapo has a long history of advocating, advising, and supporting diversity, equity, and inclusiveness. Examples can be found in its mission statement, strategic plans, degree and course offerings, community outreach programs, and other diversity programs. Ramapo’s commitment to diversity and inclusion is infused across all facets of the College; where the environment is welcoming, dedicated to social justice, respectful of freedom of expression, focused on educating and having an ongoing conversation regarding cultural competence and the benefits and importance of diversity.

title: Hotel Area Revenue Analyst
description:
**Purpose for the Position** : To assume full responsibility of supporting the revenue strategy set forth by Revenue Optimization Consultants for multi-units in assigned region. The position is responsible for supporting the Area Directors’ tactical daily revenue management practice of rate promotion and inventory controls, utilizing all distribution channels to convert capacity RevPAR potential of multiple properties, as well as organizing reporting tools for future time periods.

**Essential Responsibilities** : To ensure that ROC revenue strategies are fully supported to continuously improve daily RevPAR penetration by coordinating and verifying key pricing decisions of several hotels with multiple brands

❖ Maximizes revenue of assigned hotels through a thorough, fluent knowledge of all relevant PMS/RMS system and understanding of all booking channels. Manages inventory allocation and price parameters positioned to achieve overall revenue goals across all applicable distribution channels

❖ Maintain communication to support in identifying abnormal room pace and achieving capacity occupancies

❖ Assist in the configuration of RMS and rate inventory control systems; system recommendation and forecast validation, daily report entry and analysis to produce and implement changes in the system

❖ Support the execution of hotels RM strategy; foremost in acting as central point of communication/liaison for Area Director and property-level personnel by continuously multi-tasking between all operating systems while maintaining the highest degree of accuracy

❖ Produce and analyze key brand and property-specific marketing reports to make successful decisions to increase revenue

❖ Monitor availability and ensure strategic room type, straight-line balancing of inventory on a continuous basis across all applicable distribution channels

❖ Address prior night other room revenue charges have been executed and hotel policies upheld for portfolio

❖ Consistently produce and maintain all RM rolling reports and yield tools to include, but not limited to; booking pace, strategy yield tools, property and ownership group forecast and production reports, budget and segmentation tools, ORR production reports, internal business intelligence program, master security access sheets, internal resource center; etc.

❖ Retrieve data from multiple sources including PMS, RMS, Sales systems, inventory distribution systems and extranets to create integrated views that can be used to drive decision making

❖ Identify opportunities to design, implement and maintain reporting tools as well as optimize the business through key analytics and statistical measures

❖ Maintain the pricing and distribution strategy within the hotels PMS and extranets

❖ Assist in coordinating the production of the daily internal and weekly financial/ownership forecasts

❖ Assist the Area Director with pricing and yield decisions across all market segments based on the forecast

❖ Maintain the hotels RMS to ensure it is maximizing revenue potential on all compression dates into the future

❖ Address group blocks within the PMS for pickup/cut- offs/attrition/wash etc.

❖ Aggressively maintain a concise room type oversell/sell- through strategy for all future dates

❖ Support the rate loading process for all rate plans within all systems and continuously test book for accuracy

❖ Coordinate and attend hotels’ revenue meetings

❖ Produce routine reports for the Area Director and executive team members for analysis

❖ Take an analytical, creative and innovative approach to solving problems while maintaining a positive, people-oriented and energetic attitude

**To do this kind of work, you must be able** **to:**

➢ Read and interpret business records and statistical reports

➢ Have a clear and knowledgeable understanding of Excel

➢ Use mathematical skills to interpret financial information and prepare budgets

➢ Analyze and interpret established policies

➢ Understand government regulations covering business operation

➢ Make business decisions based on production reports and similar facts as well as on your own experience and personal opinions

➢ See differences in widths and lengths of lines such as those on graphs

➢ Deal with the general public, customers, employees, union and government officials with tact and courtesy

➢ Plan and organize the work of others

➢ Change activity frequently and cope with interruptions

➢ Speak and write clearly

➢ Accept full responsibility for managing an activity

➢ Complete all assigned tasks, reports, projects etc. in a professional manner and on an on-time basis

➢ Be available for work evenings, weekends and holidays

Work Remotely

* No

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Part Time - Fulfillment Associate - Flexible
description:
**What You Will Do**  

All Lowe’s associates deliver quality customer service while maintaining a store that is clean, safe, and stocked with the products customers need. As a Fulfillment Associate, this means:  

* Being friendly and professional, and responding quickly to customer and associate needs.
* Ensuring merchandise is in good condition, accurately accounted for, and delivered to customers on-time.
* Pulling merchandise safely for loading onto delivery trucks and helping customers and staff move merchandise safely.


The Fulfillment Associate assists customers, delivery team members, and Installation PROviders by pulling and preparing orders prior to pick up, replenishing shelves for next customers and loading merchandise into their vehicles. To meet the needs of our customers, this associate must feel comfortable engaging in conversations with other associates to ensure correct products are delivered on time. The associate helps ensure that the right products are delivered to our customers by accurately pulling, inspecting and preparing merchandise for delivery or pick up, as well as verifying invoices against loaded products. In addition, the associate ensures deliveries are ready upon truck arrival, and assists with loading merchandise, including large appliances. Safety is critical because this associate lifts and moves merchandise for staff and customers frequently throughout his/her shift. Fulfillment Associate(s) assigned to the Pro Department are required to be certified on the following Power Equipment (PE) within 30 days of their start date in the Pro Department: forklifts, pallet jacks and electrical lifts.
  

Travel Requirements: This role does not require regular travel; however, this role may need to travel on occasion to meetings, trainings, or to support neighboring stores.  

  

**What We're Looking For**  

* Hourly Full Time or Part Time: Generally scheduled 39 to 40 or up to 25 hours per week, respectively; more hours may be required based on the needs of the store.
* Requires morning, afternoon and evening availability any day of the week.
* Physical ability to perform tasks that may require prolonged standing, sitting, and other activities necessary to perform job duties.
* Minimally must be able to lift 25 pounds without assistance; may lift over 25 pounds with or without assistance.

  

**What You Need To Succeed**  

Minimum Qualifications  

* Ability to read, write, and perform basic arithmetic (addition, subtraction).
* 6 months of experience using a computer, including inputting, accessing, modifying, or outputting information.
* 6 months experience using common retail technology, such as smart phones and tablets.
* Ability to obtain sales related licensure or registration as may be required by law.

  

*Preferred Qualifications*  

* 6 months retail experience.
* 6 months of experience in a customer service or product fulfillment position at a home improvement or hardware retailer in related department (e.g., kitchen, plumbing, electrical, lawn and garden).
* 6 months experience in any industry inspecting, carrying, loading, and unloading product or material in or out of vehicles.

Pay Range: $17.00 - $18.40 per hour*Starting rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. For information regarding our benefit programs and eligibility, please visit our* *benefits page**.*
