title: Specialist, QC Support
description:
**Working with Us**  

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren't words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You'll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.  

  

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .  

  

At Bristol Myers Squibb we are reimagining the future of cell therapy. With our bold ambition, backed by a best-in-the-industry team and long-term commitment, we are leading the way to unlock the full promise of cell therapy as we strive to put more patients on the path to a cure. If you are ready to challenge yourself, accelerate your career, and give new hope to patients, there's no better place than here at BMS with our Cell Therapy team.  

  

The Specialist position performs routine activities such as preventive maintenance for non-complex and complex equipment/ instruments. Support vendor activities for preventive maintenance.  

  

**Shift Available:*** Sunday - Wednesday, Onsite Day Shift, 8 a.m. - 6:30 p.m.

**Responsibilities:*** Perform routine lab housekeeping and lab maintenance activities, such as equipment cleaning, restocking supplies, solution and reagent preparation, etc.
* Review GMP documentation/ records, including vendor executed validation documents for GDP adherence.
* May perform document revision, project, CAPA and deviation/ investigation related tasks and/ or continuous improvement efforts.
* Train others on general job duties including equipment calibration and maintenance processes, as applicable.
* Support creation of equipment User Requirement, validation protocols.
* Collaborate with QC laboratories, Site Engineering, Facility Services and other departments for the commissioning and decommissioning of laboratory equipment.
* Schedule, facilitate and participate in performing the validation, calibration, maintenance, repairs of QC laboratory equipment, whether performed internally or by vendors.
* Maintain electronic equipment database, equipment records and logs, equipment status metrics, and apply equipment status labels in accordance with GMP requirements and written procedures.
* Provide basic and first-line equipment troubleshooting.

**Knowledge & Skills:*** Ability to accurately and completely understand, follow, interpret and apply Global Regulatory and cGMP requirements.
* Problem-solving ability/mentality, technically adept and logical.
* Ability to communicate effectively with peers, department management and cross-functional peers.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment, meet deadlines, and prioritize work.

**Basic Requirements:*** Bachelor's degree or equivalent required, preferably in science. An equivalent combination of education and experience in a regulated environment will be considered.
* 1 year experience working in a manufacturing GMP facility.
* 1 year of experience with writing technical documents.
* 1 year QC lab experience.
* 1 year of experience trouble-shooting equipment.
* Knowledge of computerized systems and enterprise applications such as SAP, Valgenesis and Maximo.

BMSCART, #LI-Onsite

title: Summer 2025 - Clinical Flow Cytometry Internship
description:
**Working with Us**  

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren't words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You'll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.  

  

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .  

  

**Position Summary**  

  

The Clinical Flow Cytometry laboratory is seeking an intern to join our industry leading team of flow cytometrists. The group utilizes a diverse range of state-of-the-art specialized flow cytometers and supporting systems to develop, optimize, validate and execute flow cytometry assays in support of new drug programs. As an intern, you will gain hands on experience using modern flow cytometers, analyzing data, and the overall process to perform clinical biomarker studies that help to develop new medicines.  

  

**Key Responsibilities*** Running flow cytometry experiments in aid of assay development and validation, either autonomously or in support of senior members of the clinical flow cytometry team
* Analysis and visualization of high-dimensional flow cytometry data generated in the lab using common software such as Flowjo or computational data analysis such as Python and R
* Daily optimization and routine maintenance of flow cytometers
* Accurate record keeping of experiments and procedures
* Interacting with team members to understand the needs of individual assays
* Other tasks will be required to support the team as a whole

**Qualifications & Experience*** Current undergraduates who are entering the junior/senior year with majors in biological sciences or related field
* Strong enthusiasm and interest in science
* Some basic lab skills from college course science labs or research labs
* Ability to work in a highly matrixed team
* Excellent fundamental skills such as communications, analytical and critical thinking
* Excellent organization and record keeping skills


If you come across a role that intrigues you but doesn't perfectly line up with your resume, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be one step away from work that will transform your life and career.
  

  

**Uniquely Interesting Work, Life-changing Careers**  

With a single vision as inspiring as Transforming patients' lives through science™ , every BMS employee plays an integral role in work that goes far beyond ordinary. Each of us is empowered to apply our individual talents and unique perspectives in an inclusive culture, promoting diversity in clinical trials, while our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.  

  

**On-site Protocol**  

  

BMS has a diverse occupancy structure that determines where an employee is required to conduct their work. This structure includes site-essential, site-by-design, field-based and remote-by-design jobs. The occupancy type that you are assigned is determined by the nature and responsibilities of your role:
  

  

Site-essential roles require 100% of shifts onsite at your assigned facility. Site-by-design roles may be eligible for a hybrid work model with at least 50% onsite at your assigned facility. For these roles, onsite presence is considered an essential job function and is critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, and a positive Company culture. For field-based and remote-by-design roles the ability to physically travel to visit customers, patients or business partners and to attend meetings on behalf of BMS as directed is an essential job function.
  

  

BMS is dedicated to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace accommodations/adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Applicants can request a reasonable workplace accommodation/adjustment prior to accepting a job offer. If you require reasonable accommodations/adjustments in completing this application, or in any part of the recruitment process, direct your inquiries to adastaffingsupport@bms.com . Visit careers.bms.com/ eeo -accessibility to access our complete Equal Employment Opportunity statement.
  

  

BMS cares about your well-being and the well-being of our staff, customers, patients, and communities. As a result, the Company strongly recommends that all employees be fully vaccinated for Covid-19 and keep up to date with Covid-19 boosters.
  

  

BMS will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, pursuant to applicable laws in your area.  

  

If you live in or expect to work from Los Angeles County if hired for this position, please visit this page for important additional information: https://careers.bms.com/california-residents/

title: Sales and Operations Manager – Emergency Services
description:
A GRADE Property Restoration is a licensed restoration contractor that specializes in fire, water, and storm damage repairs of all sizes and types for commercial, multi-family, and residential properties.

The Sales and Operations Manager – Emergency Services is responsible for responding to and managing emergency property situations within a designated service area. This role combines field sales expertise with managerial oversight, ensuring rapid response to fire and storm emergencies and effective coordination of emergency services. The ideal candidate is a confident, money-motivated sales professional with a proven track record in outside sales, particularly in the home improvement or restoration industry.

We are looking for field sales rockstar to solicit, educate, and sell emergency construction services to property owners who have experienced fire, water, or storm damage to their homes or businesses.

This includes board up and tarping, water mitigation, smoke mitigation, and complete rebuild

services. You should have experience with outside sales in the home improvement industry. An ideal candidate has worked for roofing, solar, windows and siding, selling home services and is aware of the restoration industry and maybe even participated in large storm events. Experience working for other restoration companies, property management firms, and knowledge of property restoration and construction is a plus.

All leads provided.

Responsibilities:

Sales Leadership:

-Drive sales by soliciting and selling a comprehensive range of emergency construction services, including board-up, tarping, water mitigation, smoke mitigation, and full rebuilds to property owners impacted by fire, water, or storm damage.

-Develop and implement strategic sales plans to identify and pursue new business opportunities within the designated service area.

-Build and sustain strong relationships with customers, ensuring high levels of satisfaction and repeat business.

* Monitor emergency alert notifications, various social media sources as well as your own

efforts to track fire related incidents in Northern NJ to generate leads.

* Use social network to market A GRADE’s services during storms.
* Inspire a trusting rapport with customers/homeowners.
* Establish and maintain working relationships with local emergency response agencies and

local community.

* Data entry into lead generation software to create databases consisting of fire, water, or

storm victim information.

* Track and complete a daily log of job activity.
* Coordinate communications between property owners and A GRADE, until the reconstruction contract is sold, to the best of your ability.
* Manage and maintain claim files including documents and photographs.
* Keep paperwork on jobs up to date relating to A GRADE contracts, authorization forms, and homeowner expenses for reimbursements.
* Assist estimators as needed.
* Design efficient ways of reporting job status updates to owners, including the adoption of job management software. Using Microsoft Teams, What’s App, and BuilderTrend.

Team Management and Coordination:

-Supervise and coordinate the efforts of field teams and emergency service personnel to ensure effective response and service delivery.

Manage and mentor team members, providing guidance, training, and support to optimize performance and achieve departmental goals.

Oversee daily operations, ensuring that all tasks are completed efficiently and in alignment with company standards and objectives.

Proven experience in conducting performance reviews. Responsible for managing bi-weekly commission calculations and reporting, as well as overseeing quarterly performance bonus calculations and reporting.

* Track and complete a daily log of lead related activity.
* Submit weekly expense reports for work related expenses

Job Qualifications:

-Proven experience in outside sales and a strong background in the home improvement or restoration industry; experience with roofing, solar, windows, siding, or related services is a plus.

-Demonstrated managerial experience, including team supervision, performance management, and operational oversight.

-Demonstrated expertise in hiring and termination processes, including the development and implementation of training programs related to recruitment, onboarding, and employee separation.

* Ability to come into the Ledgewood, NJ office a minimum of 1 day per week.
* Bilingual English/Spanish a PLUS
* Must have documented outside sales experience.
* Preferred candidates have experience in the insurance restoration industry, knowledge of

construction or insurance policies, and experience with a CRM sales software program.

* Excellent in-person, face-to-face, personable communication skills
* Comfortable, confident, and compassionate in approaching homeowners within a stressful

and emotionally sensitive setting

* Must be professional while maintaining sensitivity to the needs of our clients.
* Critical thinking with proactive problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work independently.
* Driven, resourceful, self-motivated with can-do and positive attitude.
* Computer savvy with knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel).
* Well organized, address tasks with a sense of urgency and ability to prioritize work to meet

critical deadlines.

* Valid NJ driver’s license clear of multiple and/or major violations A MUST.
* Be willing to have a background check completed.
* In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* May require nights & weekends
* Able to work beyond a 40-hour work week as needed to complete goals & responsibilities

Other Benefits

* Gas/Mileage/Tolls reimbursement for use of your own vehicle
* Company uniforms provided – shirts, jackets, hats, etc.
* Company provided phone number and email address for business related communications
* Marketing materials & business cards

Location: On the Road (office located in Ledgewood, NJ)

Territory: All of Central & Northern NJ

Compensation: Base Salary of $70,000 + Commission

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $70,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* On call
* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* Microsoft Excel: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Ledgewood, NJ (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 25% (Preferred)

title: Court Interpreter 1/Court Interpreter 2 (Spanish)-Somerset
description:
**Description**
---------------


When you come to work for New Jersey Judiciary you will join an 8500-member strong TEAM that operates with the highest standards of independence, integrity, fairness and quality service. You will be engaged with work that has purpose, meaning and makes a difference in lives of the public we serve. We work hard every day to build the public’s trust and confidence in our court system, which includes issues such as bail reform, marijuana decriminalization and recovery court. Whether it be in a courtroom, an administrative office, a courthouse training room, an IT office or in the field, our Judiciary workforce is improving the lives of countless individuals and families every day. We honor the dignity and individualism of each member of our organization while fostering professionalism and continuous improvement in our work. **The Somerset/Hunterdon/Warren Vicinage is seeking a Court Interpreter**. The successful candidate must be bilingual in Spanish and English and able to interpret in the three modes of interpretation (sight, consecutive, and simultaneous) in court proceedings, quasi-judicial hearings, complementary dispute resolution events, court support services, weddings and other court-related events which will be held in person or virtually (using telephone and/or video conferencing equipment). The candidate must adhere to the highest ethical standards. Familiarization with courtroom protocols is preferred. The successful candidate must possess excellent time management and interpersonal skills and be able to work effectively with all levels of Judiciary staff.  

  

Under the direction of the Operations Division Manager, or designee, the qualified candidate’s responsibilities will include, but will not be limited to, interpreting court proceedings, quasi-judicial hearings, complementary dispute resolution events, court support services, weddings and other court-related events; producing translations of documents such as official forms, public signs, notices, posters, form letters, job applications and correspondence; providing introductory information regarding the role of the interpreter to pro se parties and attorneys requiring interpreting services, skills and techniques; assisting court employees and others in scheduling interpreting services; collecting and entering data into automated record-keeping systems; orienting and scheduling contract interpreters; participating in study and training activities in a group or individually in order to develop and maintain interpreting and translating skills; performing general administrative/office support functions in support of the interpreting unit; and performing related duties as required. Regular and predictable physical presence at the worksite is an essential function of this position.  

Positions will be filled at one of the following levels based on candidate qualifications:  

**Court Interpreter 1- Journey -** The salary range for this position is $71,937.01 to $102,150.53. for Schedule A, and $71,937.01 to $97,043.01 for Schedule B. **Employees at this level interpret legal proceedings and translate forms, letters and other court-related documents.**  

  

**Court Interpreter 2- Master -**The salary range for this position is $76,253.21 to $115,099.18 for Schedule A, and $76,253.21 to $109,344.22 for Schedule B. **Employees at this level may interpret complex legal proceedings; translate forms, letters and other court-related documents; mentor Court Interpreters; and interpret for trials that are high profile, complex, and which involving crimes of the first degree.**  

  

For newly hired individuals, the starting salary will normally be at the minimum of the salary range. For current Judiciary employees, salary upon promotion or advancement will be an increase of 5% of base salary, not to exceed the maximum of the range, or the minimum salary of the band/level, whichever is greater.Judiciary employees hired prior to June 3, 2014, are considered Schedule A. Newly hired individuals, and Judiciary employees hired on or after June 3, 2014, are considered Schedule B. ***The Judiciary offers a strong opportunity for growth.***  

**“Regular and predictable physical presence at the worksite is an essential function of this position.”**  

  

**REMOTE WORK****:** The Judiciary currently offers a hybrid work schedule, and this position may qualify for up to 2 days of remote work outside of Judiciary buildings. To participate in this program, in addition to installing a multifactor authentication app on your phone or tablet, you will be required to have high speed home internet access.
**Qualifications**
------------------


**Eligibility:** Eligible applicants are court interpreters approved by the New Jersey Administrative Office of the Courts (AOC). AOC approved interpreters include interpreters who have passed the written and performance oral exams of the National Center for State Courts administered by the AOC or an equivalent test administered by a member state of the Council of Language Access Coordinators; or who possess the Court Interpreter Certification from the Administrative Office of the United States Courts.  

  

**Note:** Prior to translating documents, incumbents must pass the translation test administered by the AOC.  

  

For additional information on becoming a Court Interpreter refer to
https://www.njcourts.gov/public/lang-services  


**Supplemental Information**
----------------------------


**Driver's License:** Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.  

  

**Authorization to Work:** US citizenship is not required. Selected candidate must be authorized to work in the US according to Department of Homeland Security, US Citizenship and Immigration Services regulations.  

  

**Special Note:** Newly hired employees must agree to a thorough background check that will include fingerprinting. All data received will be kept in strict confidence except to inform the individual of the findings and what action will be taken as a result of this information.  

  

**Residency Law:** In accordance with N.J.S.A. 52:14-7 (L. 2011, Chapter 70), the "New Jersey First Act," all persons newly hired by the Judiciary within one year must establish, and then maintain, principal residence in the State of New Jersey. Any person may request an exemption from that requirement from the Employee Residency Review Committee in the Department of Labor & Workforce Development on the basis of either hardship or employer critical need.  

  

**HOW TO APPLY:**  

The NJ Judiciary requires all applicants to complete the application process fully and as instructed. All applicants must complete the work experience and education sections and attach any required documents. Applications must describe all relevant work experience in detail, beginning with your current or most recent job, including military service (indicate rank), internships and job-related volunteer work, if applicable. Use a separate section to describe each position. Applicants who indicate "see resume" or enter their initials to acknowledge that they have skipped the Work History and Education sections will not be considered, unless they do not possess any education history or work experience. Only applicants that follow the application instructions and submit completed applications will be considered.  

  

The New Jersey Judiciary consists of: the Supreme Court, the Superior Court including the Appellate Division and the Trial Court of the 15 vicinages in New Jersey, the Tax Court and the Municipal Court System. The Administrative Office of the Courts provides technical assistance, operational support, training, research and development, budget and personnel coordination, and development and operation of information systems for the Courts of New Jersey.  

**The Judiciary of New Jersey is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action**  

**Employer Committed to Ensuring an Open Door to Justice**  

  

NeoGov applicant support at 1-877-204-4442 (toll free call)  

 Monday through Friday, 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM Mountain Time (MT)

title: Peer Recovery Specialist
description:
**Peer Recovery Specialist, START/SBCT Program, Newark, NJ** 

Grounded in a spirituality that treasures the dignity of all, The Center for Great Expectations seeks to create a safe place, safe presence, and a safe path, that enables clients to experience, choose and maintain physical, psychological, social and spiritual health for themselves, their children and families. Our continuum of care offers trauma-informed, behavioral health services to our clients in residential, community and outpatient settings.

The Center for Great Expectations is seeking a compassionate individual to join our START Program team as a Peer Recovery Specialist working with women in the community with substance use disorders in the Newark, NJ area.

As a Peer Recovery Specialist, you will directly impact the lives of individuals and families in recovery. You will provide compassionate and trauma-informed support, fostering a safe and healing environment. This includes offering co-regulation techniques as you engage with individuals at all stages of their recovery journey, providing education and fostering a sense of connection. You will leverage your own experiences to build trust and understanding, empowering clients to identify and connect with vital social support systems. You will also assist individuals in areas of prevention of substance use recurrence, recovery maintenance, and aftercare, providing transportation and case management as needed.

In addition to a passion for providing empathetic care, candidates must have a High school Diploma or GED as well as a be an NJ Certified Peer Recovery Specialist (CPRS) or National Certified Peer Recovery Support Specialist (NCPRSS.)

Please visit our website at www.cge-nj.org to learn more and to apply for this position.

title: Manager Quality - Westbury, NY
description:
**Date:** Sep 16, 2024


**Location:** WESTBURY, NY, US, 11590


**Company:** Hubbell Incorporated


**Job Overview**
----------------



The Quality Assurance Manager is responsible for the implementation and execution of the EIG Quality Chain Management System at the plant level. Controls all products and processes in the plant, through strict adherence to policies, specifications, and standards. This position is also responsible for the RMA group to ensure customer returns are handled expeditiously and to track trends for quality issues. Also responsible for leading the Manufacturing Engineering group on production processes and documentation to drive an efficient, cost effective workplace.  


Salary for this position is $140k based on experience.
**A Day In The Life**
---------------------


* Develops and implements a quality system, ensuring both compliance to high standards and a quality focused workforce, including the design, programs, standards and methodologies for the assurance of quality production.
* Ensure that the operations, processes and procedures that affect products quality and/or integrity comply with ISO 9001:2015 and ISO 14001:2015, including but not limited to: customer complaints, quality metrics, approval and release of finished products, incoming inspection of raw materials, management reviews, internal audit program, corporate, and customer audits, quality holds, customer notifications, market corrections or withdrawals, non-conformance and CAPA system, quality support for Design Control and New Product Introduction, Change Control, Customer requests and interactions (C of As, Quality Surveys, Quality Agreements)
* Maintain documentation and internal audit program to ensure ISO 9001 and 14001 compliance.
* Maintain documentation and processes to ensure UL compliance. Work with external auditor during monthly audits.
* Interface with suppliers and contract manufacturers on all quality related issues and hold them accountable to meet our quality standards
* Oversee all aspects of inspection and strive to eliminate or reduce inspection based on inspection records and data pulled from our ERP system.
* Retrieve data from our ERP system to hold QBR’s, MRM’s and drive improvements in Quality as stated by Corporate requirements.
* Manages the Quality group to ensure data is reviewed for incoming inspection, production and Returns to drive continuous improvement in these areas using data driven decision and implementation of corrective actions to eliminate repeat quality issues
**What will help you thrive in this role?**
-------------------------------------------


* Bachelor’s degree in engineering
* Familiar with ISO9001, ISO14001, and/or other ISO standards
* UL, CE, RoHS, REACH, NEMA and/or other compliances standards
* 8+ Years’ experience in a Quality/Manufacturing Engineering role
* Experience leading/supervising subordinates, performance management systems and with handling disciplinary issues
* Must have worked in a manufacturing environment with ISO9001 standards
* Proficient in MS Office, especially Excel and Word
* Must have experience with ERP system and QMS systems
* NetSuite experience is a strong plus.

  


#LI-KH1
**Competencies**
----------------


**Hubbell Incorporated**  


Hubbell creates critical infrastructure solutions that power our customers, communities, people and the planet. Our company is strategically aligned around enabling grid modernization and electrification. As more products plug in to an aging grid, Hubbell solutions enable the transition to a more reliable, resilient and efficient energy infrastructure. Founded in 1888 our innovation has made us a leading global manufacturer of high quality electrical and utility solutions enabling customers to operate critical infrastructure reliably and efficiently.  


The company operates in two segments. Hubbell Utility Solutions (HUS) enable the grid to conduct, communicate and control energy across utility applications and Hubbell Electrical Solutions (HES) are essential to managing power across a wide range of industries and applications. Our vertical market solutions can be applied to markets including Data Centers, Renewables, Commercial Buildings, Industrial, Telecom and Transportation. Supporting both of our business segments is our corporate and Hubbell Unified Business Solutions teams that provide consistent process, tools technologies across our businesses.  


We are committed to operating sustainably and ethically while promoting an inclusive and supportive culture for our people to grow and develop in their careers. Our employees proudly work and serve our communities from our headquarters in Shelton, CT, across the United States and around the globe.  


**Hubbell Utility Solutions**  


Hubbell Utility Solutions (HUS) enable the grid to conduct, communicate and control energy across utility applications. HUS provides the critical components that allow the grid to reliably transmit and distribute energy, as well as the communications and controls technologies to make the grid smarter and more flexible.  


Hubbell Incorporated, its subsidiaries and affiliates, is an EO Employer AA: M/F/Veteran/Disability. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other protected class.
company_description: Hubbell Incorporated is an international manufacturer of quality electrical and electronic products for a broad range of applications.

title: Housekeeping Supervisor
description:
**LodgeWorks is actively hiring for a Housekeeping Supervisor**

 **Who we are**

  

LodgeWorks is a privately held hotel development and management company. While our name isnt on the hotels themselves, our extraordinary culture is at the heart of our 18 hotels including our award-winning Archer Hotel boutique collection and our portfolio of other great brands with familiar names, such as Hyatt Place, Hyatt House, Aloft, Hilton Garden Inn and Hampton Inn.

  

Were thrilled to be considered industry innovators with a rich 35+ year history. Yet, what we are most proud of is the strong family culture we have developed and maintained while growing to 950+ employees nationwide. At LodgeWorks, hospitality is more than just the industry in which we work; it defines everything we do. Maybe its because were grounded in Midwestern hospitality (our home office is in Wichita, Kansas, while our hotels are scattered across the U.S.). Or maybe its because we actively work to make hospitality (with each other, our guests, our clients and partners) the foundation upon which everything is built.

 **Job overview**

  

The Housekeeping Supervisor supports the housekeeping and laundry departments and manages all facets of the Housekeeping Department in the absence of the Executive Housekeeper, ensuring the highest level of cleanliness and guest satisfaction.

  

They are responsible for supporting the training function of all new hired room attendants and provides on-going re-training of established room attendants. They are responsible for the general support of the Room Attendants by collecting linens, garbage, performing routine general cleaning projects, delivering items to guest rooms.

 **Your day-to-day**

  

* Approach all encounters with guests and employees in a friendly, service-oriented manner.
* Maintain regular attendance in compliance with LodgeWorks standards as required by scheduling, which varies according to hotel needs.
* Comply with LodgeWorks standards and regulations to encourage safe and efficient hotel operations.
* Supervise the housekeeping staff, providing open communication, training, coaching, counseling and performance feedback to ensure maximum efficiency.
* Supervise and inspect the cleaning of the guest rooms, turndown service, public areas and back of house; ensure compliance with health/sanitation standards and regulations to achieve a high level of cleanliness and guest satisfaction.
* Train, schedule, coach and support associates, ensuring that they perform in accordance with hotel standards and consistent with LodgeWorks core values.
* Inspect, monitor and maintain level of cleanliness in all assigned guest rooms; report all unsatisfactory conditions to the room attendant and take full responsibility to ensure that it is rectified in a timely manner.
* Support the hotels leadership team in managing labor costs within budget standards and staffing guidelines.
* Manage supply inventory and monitor storage procedures and policies throughout the property; ensure safe chemical handling and proper chemical usage procedures.
* Develop work schedules and coordinate staff work assignments in conjunction with manager.
* Monitor out-of-order, out-of-service, discrepant and show rooms.
* Monitor and act on special requests as needed (e.g., VIPs, special need rooms).
* Conduct or monitor daily stand-up meetings with staff to assign daily assignments.
* Ensure consistency with departmental opening and closing procedures.
* Inspect all VIP rooms prior to arrival.
* Conduct regular tours of work areas, reviewing housekeeping productivity in completion of assignments; perform or assist with cleaning duties as necessary.
* Respond to guest requests, concerns and problems to ensure guest satisfaction.
* Follow facility safety and security guidelines; participate in property safety committee and serve as an emergency responder for the location.
* Assist in any other task and duties as requested by management.
* Maintains departmental key control.

**Who you are**

* A team player with a heart for hospitality.
* Entrepreneurial at heart and innovative in mind.
* A long-term thinker.
* Customer-focused, with guests, clients and employees at the forefront of your thinking.
* Nimble and able to adapt to change quickly.
* Committed to sharing and togetherness and value the family mindset of our organization.
* Aware that a good reputation is a huge asset to a hotel and committed to being a representative of that great reputation.
* An excellent communicator.
* Naturally curious and value listening to solve problems.
* Comfortable following directions, guidelines and work objectives.
* Capable of exerting up to 60 pounds of force occasionally.
* Capable of standing for an entire shift or for an extended amount of time.
* Capable of reaching overhead, utilizing both hands, leaning over, stooping and kneeling.
* A plus: Practiced, with six months' related experience in hospitality or a service industry.
* A must: Eager to be part of a great work culture and team.

**Benefits**

  

We are proud to offer competitive wages and the following benefits for full-time employees:

* PTO
* Hotel and restaurant discounts available at select LodgeWorks properties
* Health, vision and dental benefits
* 401(k) plans with matching contributions
* Paid holidays
* Short-term and long-term disability (company sponsored)
* Referral bonuses
* Flexible spending accounts

 *LodgeWorks is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.*

title: Executive Associate for Rapidly Growing Tech Franchise
description:
**Join PayMore Stores: Be Part of Our Growth Journey!**

**About PayMore Stores - Electronics Franchise**

Founded in 2011 in Massapequa, New York, PayMore Stores started with a vision: to give old electronics new life while keeping them out of landfills. What began as a single store on Long Island has rapidly grown into the nation’s fastest-growing electronics franchise. We provide a premium, secure retail environment where customers can trade in their used electronics or purchase new devices—creating a unique niche in the marketplace.

As a disruptive force in second-hand electronics and eCommerce, we’re building a cutting-edge proprietary marketplace, backed by our own technology. Since franchising began in 2020, we’ve expanded to over 480 U.S. locations in development and more than 500 worldwide. Our strong unit economics, low startup costs, and streamlined operations have attracted top-tier franchisees, allowing us to redefine the electronics and second-hand industries.

**The Opportunity: Grow with PayMore Stores**

As one of the fastest-growing tech-driven franchises, we’re looking for a driven and ambitious individual who’s ready to scale with us. This is more than just a job—it’s an opportunity to become a vital part of a rapidly expanding company where your role will grow as we do. You’ll work closely with our executive team, helping to shape the future of the brand as we continue to revolutionize the industry.

We want someone who’s eager to learn, take initiative, and be an essential part of our journey. If you're looking to step into a key role with endless growth potential, we want to hear from you!

**Who We’re Looking For:**

We’re seeking an adaptable, organized office administrator with experience in executive assistance and accounting. While franchising experience is a bonus, it’s not required. We need someone versatile and proactive who can help drive our day-to-day operations and support our fast-paced expansion.

If you're a quick thinker who thrives in a dynamic environment, this role is perfect for you. Join us, and be part of our long-term growth!

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Support the Co-Founders/CEO & President and Executive Team
* Manage data, files, and utilize Google Drive and our proprietary tech platforms
* Assist franchisees with onboarding, development, and ongoing support
* Organize content for social media platforms such as LinkedIn and Instagram
* Coordinate with vendors and external partners
* Manage schedules and ensure tasks are completed on time
* Support public relations efforts and marketing initiatives
* Maintain smooth office operations
* Assist with franchisor business management and corporate director support
* Handle accounting tasks including invoicing and collaborating with the accounting team (experience with Stripe is a plus)
* Plan and organize company events, summits, training sessions, and grand openings
* Manage general correspondence with partners

**What You Bring:**

* A growth mindset, eager to evolve with a rapidly growing company
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks
* High attention to detail and organizational prowess
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Google Suite/Drive, and Canva
* A proactive attitude, able to take direction and independently spearhead initiatives
* Creativity, innovation, and a personable, professional demeanor
* Comfort working with technology

**Schedule:**

* Full-time, in-office: Monday-Friday, 9am-5pm, with occasional extended hours based on deadlines
* Some travel required, including attendance at our annual franchisee convention

**Compensation:**

* $60,000 Salary + Incentives and Bonuses
* ½ Medical Coverage Paid
* Paid Major Holidays
* Location: Corporate Massapequa, NY (near Massapequa LIRR station)

**Ready to grow with us?**  
Become a key part of PayMore Stores and help us shape the future of electronics retail! Apply today and embark on a journey of growth and opportunity with one of the fastest-growing franchises in the industry.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Weekends as needed

Ability to Commute:

* Massapequa, NY 11758 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Massapequa, NY 11758: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: EMA Scheduler
description:
Castleton Commodities International is hiring an EMA Scheduler role for our US Physical Power business in our Stamford, CT office. This role will play a pivotal role in the business, performing commercial functions around providing energy management services to internal and external clients of CCI. These energy management services focus on the management of generators in the eastern ISO’s of the US. This role will report to the Energy Management Manager role within the US Physical Power business.
Responsibilities
Ongoing responsibilities include:* Perform day to day energy management activities. This includes bidding and scheduling of generating units, coordination with fuel suppliers, communications with internal and external stakeholders, as well as related activities. (75%)
* Weekly rotation to provide off hours coverage. (20%)
* Origination and Business development for new and existing client opportunities (5%).


Qualifications:* Deep understanding of ISO rules and regulations, with a focus on NYISO, PJM, ISONE and other eastern markets.
* Strong understanding of overall the energy management marketplace and the needs of generators.
* 2+ years of relevant experience with some prior exposure to the energy/commodities industry
* Proficiency in ETRM systems (ideally CXL), Bid-to-Bill systems is required. Exposure to other energy related data systems is a plus.
* Strong organizational/time management skills with an ability to multi-task and adhere to tight deadlines.
* Strong technical, analytical, and communication skills.
* Strong attention to detail and demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively.
* Proficiency in VBA, Excel
* Ability to participate in weekend and off-hour on call rotations as required.


Employee Programs & Benefits:
CCI offers competitive benefits and programs to support our employees, their families and local communities. These include:* Competitive comprehensive medical, dental, retirement and life insurance benefits
* Employee assistance & wellness programs
* Parental and family leave policies
* CCI in the Community: Each office has a Charity Committee and as a part of this program employees are allocated 2 days annually to volunteer at the selected charities.
* Charitable contribution match program
* Tuition assistance & reimbursement
* Quarterly Innovation & Collaboration Awards
* Employee discount program, including access to fitness facilities
* Competitive paid time off
* Continued learning opportunities


Visit https://www.cci.com/careers/life-at-cci/# to learn more!
company_description: Castleton Commodities International is an independent global energy commodity merchant and infrastructure asset investor.

title: Shipping and Receiving Clerk
description:
**Job Title:** **Shipping and Receiving Clerk**
===============================================

Location:
Garden City, NY, US, 11530
Business Unit: Treitler FMH
Posting Date: Sep 16, 2024
Job Description:
Work Schedule: Monday-Friday, 7:00am-3:30pm

  


**Position Summary:**

* **This role performs a variety of operations connected with the receipt and shipment of products.**
* **Verify, record and deliver all** **incoming products**
* **Enter all receipts in oracle**
* **Unload all delivery trucks (forklift)**
* **outgoing shipments and prepare items for shipping. Compare identifying information and counts, weights or measure item to verify against invoices, orders or other records.**
  


**Supervisory Responsibilities:**


* None

  




**Duties and Responsibilities**:


* **Load and Unload Delivery Trucks**
* **Receive and deliver all incoming products**
* **Perform electronic inventory transactions**
* **Insert items into container, using spacers, fillers, protective passing or using Instapak Foaming Machine.**
* **Bind cartons using tape shooter.**
* **Stamp, stencil or glue identifying information and shipping instructions onto crates or containers.**
* **Post weights, shipping charges and affix postage.**
* **Operate tier-lift truck, forklift truck or use hand truck to move, convey or hoist shipments from packing area to shipping platform.**
* **Bind containers with metal tape, suing strapping machine.**
* **Perform electronic inventory trransactions to pull orders to ship.**
* **Navigate to and update customer portals as required daily.**
* **Prepare and type shipping and related documents, such as waybills, express delivery forms and government DD250 forms.**
* **Must have the ability to operate forklifts in a safe manner throughout the facility.**
* **Maintain and organize the work area to assure safe working conditions and support daily visual flow management guidelines.**
* **Perform, as assigned, other similar or related duties.**

  




**Required Skills and Abilities****:**


* Ability to use UPS/Fed-Ex transactions terminals
* Precise and effective phone communication skills
* Ability to work with minimal supervision.
* Self-Starter
* Ability to learn and apply new skills
* Accuracy important (systems transactions)
* Ability to interact with truck vendors

  




**Education and Experience:**


* High School Diploma or GED Certificate and equivalent experience (On the Job Training)
* PC with Windows, Oracle or Database experience is required
* Fluency in English Required

  




**Physical Requirements:**

* Prolonged sitting, standing, and core-body movement required
* Ability to safely lift up to 70lbs, team lift over 70lbs required
* Due to contracts with the United States Government, the candidate must be either a United States Citizen or Green Card holder

----------------

Salary Maximum: $50,000
Incentive: No

title: Production Manager
description:
**Job Title:** **Production Manager**
=====================================

Location:
Garden City, NY, US, 11530
Business Unit: Treitler FMH
Posting Date: Sep 16, 2024
Job Description:
**Position Summary:**

The Production Manager is responsible for achieving business goals including product cost and quality, schedule adherence and delivery on-time to customer demand. This is a hands-on position that is responsible for maximizing daily production and driving efficiency to improve profitability.

  


This position plays an integral part in plant operations, special projects, and is responsible for developing and maintaining motivated staff and for developing and achieving budgetary and production targets. This position directly and indirectly leads a production team of 25 to 75 associates, both union and non-union.

  


This person will ensure that a proper organizational structure is in place that utilizes lean manufacturing processes to direct plant operations, consistent with sales forecasts, production schedules and planned growth. The key to success in this position is consistently meeting production and sales (revenue and profit) goals.

  


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Manage the production process and influence all relevant support functions to achieve customer fulfillment expectations.
* Responsible for achievement of KPI’s related to shipping volume targets, on-time delivery, past due backlog, customer lead time, efficiency, utilization, and overtime premium expense.
* Own and drive continuous improvements in manufacturing metrics including quality, yields, cycle time, productivity, and cost. Promote process improvement, and LEAN manufacturing and 5S techniques.
* Quantify current state product cost standards with goals / plans for continuous improvement.
* Implement and drive continuous improvement activities through implementation of change management process and best practices.
* Generate current month and future month’s head count requirements plan.
* Rectify product cost variances to target (root cause and corrective actions).
* Drive resolution to material availability issues with planning and supply chain resources. Inventory handling/management and accuracy within plant.
* Timely and thorough implementation of engineering changes. Actively partner in the creation and review of engineering changes when needed.
* Provide leadership and training to accomplish the company goals and objectives. Provide direction, development and leadership to production supervisors and leads. Schedule staff appropriately to perform production duties and meet efficiency goals.
* Lead daily production standup meetings at the beginning of shifts with department supervisors to direct production activities and establish production priorities.
* Develop and track improvement in reduction of planned direct labor hours to earned hours.
* Coordinate, set up, and implement standard operating procedures for all production operations.
* Establish and monitor overall performance for product and quality standards; recommend process improvements / quality control programs. Recommend changes in work practices to improve production standards and product quality.
* Working with manufacturing engineering in setting/delivering labor and production quality standards.
* Ensure implementation and compliance of health and safety protocol.
* Maintain a constant awareness of jobs being processed, production issues and equipment malfunctions to quickly determine necessary alternatives to maintain production schedules and on-time delivery.
* Coordinate with materials department to ensure all needed components are delivered in accordance to the production schedule.
* Coordinate new product introductions (NPI) with product development department to ensure production ready processes.

  




**Required Skills and Abilities:**

* Must possess solid analytical skills in forecasting and anticipating production needs and capabilities
* Must be able to prioritize workload in a multitasking environment.
* Must be able to work independently with minimum supervision and have the ability to interact positively and motivate others.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Experience with MRP systems; preferably Oracle
* Proficient in Microsoft Office programs to include Teams, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
* Willingness to work a flexible schedule to get the job done.
* Exceptional communication skills; promoting teamwork and a positive work environment.
* Experience should include build-to-order manufacturing management experience in medium volume/high-mix production environments, preferably in the military or aerospace industries.
* Demonstrated history of successful change implementation and implementing of operational excellence improvements such as lean manufacturing, demand flow, and six sigma.
* Strong ability to communicate with all levels of the organization from the production floor to the executive office; strong interpersonal, leadership, & organizational skills.
* Familiar with a manufacturing machining environment.
* Demonstrated knowledge of and familiarity with a variety of lean tools and methodologies including, but not limited to: VSM, Standard Work, Pull Systems & Kanban, Integrated Business Planning, Daily Management, 5S/Visual Management, 3P, SMED, TPM, Variation Reduction and Six Sigma.

  




**Education and Experience:**


* Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering or other technical related discipline is required; MBA or other relevant advanced degree is preferred.
* Minimum 5 years’ experience in a manufacturing environment, including managing salaried and hourly staffs
* Minimum 3 years using continuous improvement methodologies, LEAN, Six Sigma, etc.
**Compensation**
----------------


Salary Minimum: $110,000
Salary Maximum: $160,000
Incentive: No
Disclaimer: Where a specific pay range is noted, it is a good faith estimate at the time of this posting. The actual salary offered will be based on experience, skills, qualifications, market / business considerations, and geographic location.

title: Art Teacher (6-8)
description:
Central Jersey College Prep Charter School (CJCP) is a tuition-free, public charter school located in Somerset and New Brunswick, New Jersey. Serving grades Kindergarten through 12th, CJCP has a diverse student population from urban and suburban neighborhoods. CJCP first opened in 2006 with 77 students, now serving over 1,300 students with about 200 faculty and staff. CJCP is a recipient of many awards and designations such as 2016 Blue Ribbon Award, NJDOE Top-Performing Tier-I Status, US News Best High Schools, and College Board Female Diversity Awards.

CJCP has produced a 100% graduation rate and a 100% acceptance rate into four-year colleges and universities since 2011.The mission of CJCP is to provide academic and social challenges and opportunities for students to attain the skills necessary for success in post-secondary education. CJCP serves its mission by offering rigorous educational programs with an emphasis on college preparation, college and career counseling, and extracurricular enrichment activities.Art TeacherCentral Jersey College Prep Charter School is accepting applications for ArtTeacher; a tenure track position.Essential Duties: Provides content-related and appropriate instruction based on NJ Student Learning Standards;Provides classroom environment which promotes active learning in subject area;Exhibits knowledge of performance-based instruction and assessment;Communicates responsibly with students, parents, colleagues, and school leadership;Accounts for student attendance and punctuality;Follows all county, state, and federal policies and procedures;Follows professional ethics in all work-related activities;Additional Responsibilities: Prepares adequately for responsibilities to be assumed when absent;Works with parents/guardians in all aspects of the students educational programs;Facilitates home-school communication by such means as holding conferences, telephoning, and sending written communication;Integrates appropriate technology into classroom instruction;Avoids behaviors which detract from staff morale;Performs other duties as assigned by the appropriate administrator.Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Proven communication and instructional strategies;Classroom management skills;Excellent communication skills both orally and in writing;Excellent organizational skills.Minimum Requirements: Bachelors degree from an accredited college or university;Valid NJ CE, CEAS, or Standard Teacher Certification;NJ Criminal History letter;Work authorization in the U.S.;Tuberculosis Test;Experience is a plus.Opportunities at CJCP: A tenure track position;Comprehensive health and dental insurance at a low cost;NJ state teachers pension plan (TPAF) enrollment;Tuition reimbursement assistance;Paid professional development opportunities;Paid time off;Opportunities for extra stipends.

title: Plumber Apprentice
description:
\\*Overview\\* We are seeking an Apprentice Plumber to join our team. This position offers an excellent opportunity for individuals looking to start a career in plumbing. title: Estate Horticulture Manager/ Head Gardener
description:
Job Description:

As an Estate Groundsman/Horticulture Manager, you will oversee the maintenance, care, and development of the estate's grounds, ensuring they are aesthetically pleasing, sustainable, and thriving. You will be responsible for managing a variety of tasks related to landscaping, horticulture, and groundskeeping to enhance the overall beauty and functionality of the estate.

Key Responsibilities:

Planting and Maintenance: Oversee the planting, transplanting, and maintenance of vegetation on the estate grounds, ensuring proper care and attention to detail. Implement best practices for soil preparation, irrigation, fertilization, pruning, and pest management to promote plant health and vitality.

Groundskeeping: Manage all aspects of grounds maintenance, including mowing, edging, weeding, mulching, and debris removal. Maintain turf areas, pathways, and hardscapes to ensure a clean, safe, and attractive environment for residents and visitors.

Irrigation and Water Management: Design, install, and maintain irrigation systems to deliver water efficiently to plants while minimizing waste. Monitor soil moisture levels, adjust irrigation schedules as needed, and troubleshoot irrigation system issues to ensure optimal plant hydration.

Pest and Disease Control: Monitor plants for signs of pests, diseases, and other health issues. Develop and implement integrated pest management (IPM) strategies to control infestations and mitigate plant damage using environmentally responsible methods.

Seasonal Care and Enhancement: Plan and execute seasonal maintenance tasks, such as pruning, fertilizing, and seasonal planting, to keep the estate grounds looking their best year-round. Coordinate special projects and enhancements to enhance the estate's beauty and functionality.

* Maintain the landscaping and grounds, including mowing lawns, trimming bushes, planting flowers, and maintaining irrigation systems.
* Assist with snow removal and ice management during the winter months.

Equipment and Tool Management: Maintain and oversee the use of groundskeeping equipment, tools, and machinery, ensuring they are properly maintained, serviced, and operated safely. Keep an inventory of supplies and equipment, and coordinate repairs or replacements as needed.

Team Leadership and Training: Provide leadership, guidance, and supervision to groundskeeping staff, ensuring they are properly trained, motivated, and equipped to perform their duties effectively. Delegate tasks, set priorities, and foster a positive work environment within the groundskeeping team.

Qualifications:

\\*TO APPLY YOU MUST HAVE A LETTER OF RECOMMENDATION FROM A PREVIOUS EMPLOYER AND HAVE 3 PROFESSIONAL REFERENCES\\*

Proven experience in groundskeeping, landscaping, or horticulture, preferably in a residential or estate setting.

Strong knowledge of plant identification, cultivation, and maintenance techniques.

Familiarity with landscaping principles, horticultural practices, and groundskeeping equipment.

Excellent organizational, communication, and problem-solving skills.

Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage time effectively.

Commitment to quality, attention to detail, and a passion for enhancing outdoor spaces.

Valid driver's license and ability to operate groundskeeping equipment safely.

This job description outlines the key responsibilities and qualifications for an Estate Groundsman/Horticulture Manager position. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in maintaining and enhancing the beauty, health, and functionality of the estate's grounds while providing exceptional service to residents and visitors.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $85,000.00 per year

Experience:

* Gardening: 2 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Port Washington, NY (Required)

title: Receptionist/Legal Administrative Assistant
Assistant General Counsel – Antitrust and Commercial
description:
**Job Description:**


**Role:** Assistant General Counsel – Antitrust and Commercial


**About the Team** :


The Legal department has deep expertise in all core practice areas relevant to a global media and information company, including labor and employment, commercial agreements across all our businesses, privacy, intellectual property, M&A, litigation, corporate governance, compliance, media law and a variety of other specialties. The team is also responsible for the company's compliance program, including screening for compliance with international sanctions, enforcement of company policies—such as the Dow Jones Code of Conduct—and bolstering internal systems and controls.


**About the Role** :


This Assistant General Counsel role will primarily focus on antitrust matters, including compliance, investigations, M&A and strategic advice for Dow Jones' global businesses including OPIS. In addition to antitrust responsibilities, you will have the opportunity to support Dow Jones commercial teams in a variety of commercial and contractual matters, focusing on Dow Jones' B2C businesses including The Wall Street Journal, Barron's, MarketWatch, and Investor's Business Daily. The position will report to the Deputy General Counsel in New York, NY.


**You Will** :


* **Antitrust:**
* Provide legal advice on antitrust matters, including mergers and acquisitions, joint ventures, and commercial partnerships.
* Conduct antitrust risk assessments and support antitrust compliance programs.
* Represent the company in antitrust investigations and coordinate with external counsel as needed.
* Monitor and analyze changes in antitrust laws and regulations, both in and outside the United States, and advise on their implications for the company.
* Create training materials and conduct antitrust training for Dow Jones legal and business partners.
* **Commercial Contracts:**
* Work with Dow Jones' experienced commercial legal team to develop skills in drafting, reviewing and negotiating a wide range of commercial contracts, including vendor agreements, service contracts, and partnership agreements.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure contracts meet business needs and legal requirements.
* Provide legal guidance on contract-related matters and support contract lifecycle management.

**You Have:**


* Juris Doctor (JD) degree from an accredited law sc.
* Admission to the bar in [State/Country].
* At least 5 years of relevant legal experience, with at least 3 years antitrust experience, preferably in a corporate or law firm environment.
* Experience implementing antitrust compliance policies and training programs.
* Interest in handling commercial contracts and negotiations.
* Excellent analytical, communication, and negotiation skills.
* Ability to manage multiple priorities and work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
* A dedication to ethics and professional responsibility.

Our Benefits


* Comprehensive Healthcare Plans
* Paid Time Off
* Retirement Plans
* Comprehensive Insurance Plans
* Lifestyle programs & Wellness Resources
* Education Benefits
* Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support
* Commuter Transit Program
* Subscription Discounts
* Employee Referral Program

Learn more about all our US benefits.


Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.


Business Area: Dow Jones - Legal


Job Category: Legal, Compliance & Audit


Union Status:


Non-Union role


Pay Range: $210,000 - $255,000


We recognize that attracting the best talent is key to our strategy and success as a company.As a result, we aim for flexibility in structuring competitive compensation offers to ensure we are able to attract the best candidates.The quoted salary range represents our good faith estimate as to what our ideal candidates are likely to expect, and we tailor our offers within the range based on the selected candidate's experience, industry knowledge, location, technical and communication skills, and other factors that may prove relevant during the interview process.


Pay-for-performance is a key element in our strategy to attract, engage, and motivate talented people to do their best work. Similarly to salary, for bonus eligible roles, targets are set based on a variety of factors including competitive market practice.


For benefits eligible roles, in addition to cash compensation, the company provides a comprehensive and highly competitive benefits package, with a variety of physical health, retirement and savings, caregiving, emotional wellbeing, transportation, and other benefits, including "elective" benefits employees may select to best fit the needs and personal situations of our diverse workforce..


Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.


This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.


**If you are a current employee at Dow Jones, do not apply here. Please go to the Career section on your Workday homepage and view "Find Jobs - Dow Jones." Thank you.**

THE OPPORTUNITY
Scholastic is seeking a Field Sales Assistant for the independent bookstore channel and Books-A-Million. The sales assistant will report to the Director of Field Sales/Special Markets and provide sales support to our field sales team.

WHO WE ARE
Scholastic Corporation (NASDAQ: SCHL) is the world's largest publisher and distributor of children's books, a leading provider of core literacy curriculum and professional services, and a producer of educational and entertaining children's media. The Company creates quality books and ebooks, print and technology-based learning programs for pre-K to grade 12, classroom magazines and other products and services that support children's learning both in school and at home. title: Associate Recall Risk Consultant
description:
Cahill Consultants, Inc. is a woman-owned and operated, full-service consulting firm that deploys customized and tailor-made services in the areas of regulatory compliance and analysis, process improvements and optimization, product recall, risk management, and professional training programs. At Cahill Consultants, Inc., we focus on developing long-term strategies that enhance our clients' preparedness and resilience in the presence of product safety challenges.

As an Associate Recall Risk Consultant at Cahill Consultants, Inc., you will play a critical role in supporting the recall management process within our organization. You will assist in identifying, assessing, and managing potential risks that could lead to a product recall by ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and safeguarding consumer safety. This role requires meticulous writing skills, strong research and analytical skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional team members.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Assist our clients in evaluating the potential risks and impacts associated with product recalls, considering factors such as product safety, regulatory compliance, customer impact, and brand reputation
* Draft client projects by Analyzing data related to product defects, complaints, and quality issues to identify trends or patterns that could indicate potential risks for recalls
* Research new topics and draft industry-leading whitepapers
* Collaborate closely with team members at various levels within the organization
* Assist the CEO and the team in the development and execution of special projects, which will require travel
* Maintain accurate records for all clients
* Develop training sessions and educational programs for clients to stay informed regarding industry best practices, regulatory changes, and hot topics related to our field

**Skills and Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as Risk Management, Business Administration, or Quality Assurance preferred
* Knowledge of regulatory requirements related to product safety and recalls (e.g., FDA, USDA, CPSC, NHSTA) preferred
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
* Superior research skills
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Detail-oriented and organized, capable of managing multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously
* Strong self-starter with the capability to manage tasks autonomously and proactively
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), Adobe Suite, and other office software
* Previous experience in a related role or internship in risk management, quality assurance, or regulatory compliance is preferred but not required

**Working Conditions:**

* **Location:** Office environment – Located in East Setauket, New York
* **Hours:** [Full-time] regular working hours, typically 9am – 5pm
* **Travel:** Occasional travel may be required for client facility visits and meetings, as needed

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year
